story:
About this Project

The Menstrual Hygiene Project is managed by Community Development Network (CDN) Cameroon, a youth-led, not for profit, apolitical, nongovernmental, humanitarian organization under decree No. 023/RDA/B15/A2/SAAJP, created to support rural development challenges and to promote the aspirations of the poor, vulnerable and marginalized population of Cameroon. 

This project targets school-going girls from disadvantaged social and economic backgrounds in selected rural communities in the Northwest, West and Southwest regions of Cameroon. Through our workshops, we will distribute menstrual cups, reusable pads, and period underwear to girls in more than 300 schools, both primary and secondary. 

During workshop sessions, we organize training and question-and-answer sessions to give girls a forum where they can ask questions freely and discuss other related topics. Our staff also addresses other hindrances to education these girls face. Through dialogue and education, we aim to empower girls to keep their education as the number one priority.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of the Menstrual Hygiene Project is to empower girls through menstrual hygiene management to better care for their bodies, answer questions they might have, and keep them in school. Through honest and open dialogue, we equip the girls with the knowledge they need to feel more confident about their bodies. This in turn helps the girls to develop a higher level of self-esteem. 

We make a point to challenge the myths and misconceptions that surround puberty and menstruation, and leave the girls with a more solid understanding of their health. We distribute menstrual hygiene supplies along with detailed instructions on how to use and care for each product.

By providing menstrual hygiene supplies, we can reduce absenteeism amongst girls and ensure that their education is never again hindered by their sex.

 

The Impact

By using the menstrual hygiene supplies as an entry point upon which to engage girls, we can elaborate on wider issues related to menstrual hygiene and reproductive health. This project also demonstrates how such contact with girls and their communities on a specific issue can be used to promote and develop wider action on issues concerning girls’ health. We also hope to develop better educational outcomes and identify more effective strategies for improving those outcomes moving forward.

In the meantime, our campaign to demystify menstruation will be rolled out at grassroots school levels. We aim to show girls that, when they don’t speak out about the issues they face, they contribute to the silence and stigma around menstruation. Our project encourages them to use their voices, talk about these issues as well as about themselves, and stand up for their rights.

The overriding objective of the project is to ensure the target school girls will not have to miss school simply because they are menstruating. Other objectives are to:

Improve school attendance among girls between the ages of 10- 17 in primary & secondary schools

Increase access of vulnerable adolescent girls to sanitary pads and comprehensive knowledge of menstrual hygiene management

Increase risk awareness of HIV&AIDS among in-school and out of school girls 

Increase the self-esteem of needy girls between ages 10 to 17 years 

Improve economic status for out of young women between 18-34 years

 

Risks & Challenges

The project aims to purchase re-usable sanitary pads for female primary and secondary (Day) school students. These sanitary pads are made from natural and chemical free materials and are usable for about one year. Thus, the project aims to raise money to support the purchase of the necessary sanitary pads and distribute all pads to the target primary and secondary schools.

Community Development Network will organize training and question-and-answer sessions in each of the schools at the start, middle, and end of the project. We will hold a forum with female students to discuss the sanitary pads and concurrent problems they encounter, and then involve them in organizing the training. We will also set up clubs in these schools that will follow-up with the girls and involve their parents in promoting menstrual hygiene management.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your donations help us to provide reusable sanitary pads, menstrual cups, and period underwear for upper primary and secondary school girls. The funds also help us to secure workshop locations, coordinate with local schools, and provide the educational materials we have curated for the girls.

We are working on hats, wrist bands, t-shrits and other branded merchandise for this project. Of course, we also accept volunteers (both remote and local) to help us facilitate our workshops. 

Please contact us at info@codevnet.org to learn more about how you can help.

Thus, the project aims to raise money to support the purchase of the necessary sanitary pads and distribute all pads to the target primary and secondary schools.
Community Development Network will organize training and question-and-answer sessions in each of the schools at the start, middle, and end of the project. We will hold a forum with female students to discuss the sanitary pads and concurrent problems they encounter, and then involve them in organizing the training. We will also set up clubs in these schools that will follow-up with the girls and involve their parents in promoting menstrual hygiene management.
Other Ways You Can Help
Your donations help us to provide reusable sanitary pads, menstrual cups, and period underwear for upper primary and secondary school girls. The funds also help us to secure workshop locations, coordinate with local schools, and provide the educational materials we have curated for the girls.
We are working on hats, wrist bands, t-shrits and other branded merchandise for this project. Of course, we also accept volunteers (both remote and local) to help us facilitate our workshops. 
Please contact us at info@codevnet.org to learn more about how you can help.

story:
Short Summary

Introductions

Hello, my name is John. This is my first time doing this so I'm not all that sure where to begin. I guess I should start by saying that there are really two stories/introductions here. One is considerably less relevant and important than the other, so let's start there. That would be my intro. I am a recent college graduate. I was a high honors, "A" student, who always liked business, and had a gift for numbers. I was born and grew up in the good old USA, and realize that I am very fortunate. We (Americans) have so many things that we take for granted. Many will immediately point to things like electricity, running water, plenty of food, and a good sewage system :). While that's all true, the things that we are really fortunate to have aren't really the "tangible" amenities at all. It's our freedoms, and our principles; things such as freedom of religion. While we might disagree in our theology, or even who is God, we have the freedom to believe/worship as we please without the fear of death. Neither you nor I would ever try to kill each other over this.

This leads me to my "second" story/ introduction. An article caught my attention a few days ago it was about a young army veteran who after his tour ended in the Middle East decided Christians in that part of the world desperately needed help. Instead of "looking" for someone to "do the helping" he decided to do it himself. His name is Brett Felton. He is a Christian who decided that it was unacceptable to let the ISIS killers murder Christians, crucify children, rape women, and toss homosexuals off of roof tops. While I am not there, I know that his militia (the Dweikh Nawsha) has stood up to ISIS on numerous occasions, and has won (as Brett is still alive this is a sure sign of victory). They have stood even when their allies ran, and took all of the heavy weapons with them.

As a fellow believer I believe that God is on Brett's side, and that is certainly enough for any cause. However, does that mean we should do nothing, or that we do not have an obligation to act? While this is definitely a religious issue, I believe it is also a humanitarian issue. Whether you're a Christian, Muslim, Jew, atheist, or anything else in-between we should all be able to agree that the things ISIS does on a daily basis are crimes against humanity, and belong in the dark ages, not in 2015. 

So what are we going to do? When people ask Brett why you he responds with "Why not? Why just me? Where’s everyone else at?” This young man is relying on his beliefs, his faith, his training and skills to do the hard part; shouldn't we at the very least be supporting him and his brave humanitarian efforts with funding?

What We Need & What You Get

Where does the money go? I thought about this long and hard, I think the best place is where we can get the biggest return on each and every penny of your money. For that reason I have selected 2 places.

1. First, would be Brett; I will be contacting him directly and offering him part of the funding. I can't think of anyone who would be better at knowing what needs to be done, and how to get it done. Furthermore, as he is on the ground doing most of this on his own time with his own resources, very little of the money would need to go to "overhead expenses"; unlike many of the more traditional charities.

2. The second would be Mercury One.  It is a 501c3 with a twist. While they are a "more traditional charity", they do special events to pay for their "overhead expenses" this way 100% of the funds they receive throughout the year can be used to assist the desired cause. I will also be contacting them directly, and providing them with a check so that there will not be any additional credit card processing fees.

In short I will do my absolute best to be a good steward with the funds that you have entrusted with me. 

Perks

Ok so now the "fun part".

I know many of you have families and other responsibilities, and there are many good causes out there.  Sometimes this makes it difficult to give as much as each of you would like. While I was still in college I had an idea on how to help others. Basically, we need to offer something useful that families use on a daily basis so that the donation money could come from "household expenses" instead of money that was reserved for taking your family out.

In 2014 my father and I launched a company that does just that! We decided to offer laundry products, and have since added several products including hand soap and dish sop to our line. We are authorized distributors of all products that we have listed as perks, so if there are any question/concerns or special requests please email me, and I will do my best to help you.

I have set up several "rewards" categories" (listed below), and would be happy to add more if you require it.  We want to help, and will be providing the products for what it costs us to get them from the manufactur! This will insure that as much of your donation as possible will go to help those who need your help so desperately.

The Impact

Indigogo wants me to tell each of you what a difference your donation will make. It's true your donation will have an impact, how much of one is really up to each of you. The more funds we can raise the more aid and humanitarian supplies we can provide. While one donation is greatly appreciated, a bigger impact can be made by getting the word out. Will you share this on social media? Will you bring it up at church? Are you a member of other organizations that could do a "group buy"?

I believed that our success is only limited by our own imagination, determination, and willingness to work hard.  How far will you go?

That is the only true way of defining our success, and answering what kind of an impact we will have.

Risks & Challenges

For this fundraiser this section is almost ironic. What do we risk? Failure? If we fail, they are no worse off than they are now, and we will still be able to go hug our loved ones and be "secure".

The challenge is success, and that can only be measured by you. Each person that cares and decides to act is a small victory.  As we stand and work together, we will succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

As I mentioned earlier most of this campaigns success rests with each of you, and donating is one of many things you can do. The internet is an amazing tool that provides each of us with the ability to become the media. We can advertise, advocate, share, and communicate in way that past generations could only dream about so get the word out there; spread this on social media, or through emails ( I am also suppose to remind you about Indy Go Go share tools). You can also bring this up at church meetings, or anywhere else that has a group that is willing to listen. Since we are a distributor, I have access to an unlimited quantity of our products, so if you happen to be a member of a million member mega-church, or if you just want to go door to door (Girl Scout style) we can handle it.

And remember, you are only limited by your imagination, determination, and willingness to work hard.  The success of this campaign rests with you

"Open your mouth, judge righteously; defend the rights of the poor and needy."  Proverbs 31:9

story:
Appello per tutti i sostenitori del progetto Vaccini Puliti, chiediamo il vostro aiuto per le analisi di due vaccini che attualmente non sono stati ancora analizzati. Revaxis e NeisVac C

Come funziona la raccolta fondi?
Oggi giovedì 23 marzo 2017 vogliamo chiudere la raccolta fondi per i 1000 euro restanti, abbiamo già raccolto 2000€ su 3000€ necessari. 

Manca quindi solo un terzo della cifra totale, per le analisi i due vaccini che attualmente non sono stati ancora analizzati. 

Questi vaccini hanno il nome di:
1 Revaxis
Fogglietto illustrativo: 
http://www.starbene.it/farmaci/revaxis-1sir-1d-0,5ml+2-aghi_034457111


2 NeisVac C
Foglietto illustrativo: 
http://www.starbene.it/farmaci/neisvac-c-im-1sir-0,5ml_035602010

Alcune informazioni utili:
A seguito della pubblicazione avvenuta il 23 gennaio 2017, sull'autorevole rivista medica online Medcrave, della ricerca finale, durata oltre 15 anni, sulla qualità dei vaccini è emerso un grave problema di contaminazione degli stessi.

Ricerca: http://medcraveonline.com/IJVV/IJVV-04-00072.pdf

Gruppo Facebook di riferimento: 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/156506994850085/

Per chi preferisse optare per una donazione tramite conto corrente la può effettuare direttamente a questo iban :

Nanodiagnostics srl

c/o Banco Popolare

Agenzia 3 – Modena

IBAN: IT77X0503412903000000023093

CAUSALE:

Vaccini Puliti - Donazione per analisi Revaxis e NeisVac C

Aggiornamento dato che in rete si sono diffuse polemiche sulla raccolta fondi chi non volesse utilizzare Indiegogo per farlo può utilizzare le informazioni presenti sul sito di Montanari:

http://www.stefanomontanari.net/sito/sostienici.html - sul sito ufficiale di Montanari

Le donazioni, per chi vorrà farle, dovranno pervenire al conto corrente postale (BancoPosta) dedicato n. 7231168 (da usare per i versamenti postali)
IBAN: IT34D0760112900000007231168 (da usare per i bonifici bancari)

Per le donazioni via PostePay, il numero di carta è

4023600591621810

Per donazioni dall’estero si usa il BIC (o codice Swift): BPPIITRRXXX

L’intestatario in ogni caso è Stefano Montanari e la causale dovrà essere DONAZIONE.

Il mio codice fiscale è

MNT SFN 49H07 A944T

NOTA: il Dottor Montanari eseguirà le analisi, la raccolta fondi è organizzata e gestita da me Mida Riva assieme al proponente Alessandro P.

Ci tengo a precisare che i fondi raccolti andranno automaticamente sul iban di Montanari, ne io ne Alessandro maneggeremo i soldi raccolti, questo come misura preventiva volta ad evitare spiacevoli inconvenienti.

Per qualsiasi informazione contattatemi tramite il mio profilo Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1079265985

story:
We are asking for friends, fans, family, industry peers, and people from all walks of life who may not know who Corey is or what this story is about, to all help pitch in.  He is fighting back against the Hollywood system, the best way a man created in the system, knows how to defend himself; by telling his truth through his art.  This is much bigger than raising finance for a film, this is about the balance of Good and Evil in very real terms.  

Ever since Corey announced he was working on a plan to come forward with more information, he has been arrested, had a near death event, and his band quit with no explanation other than saying they were afraid to continue.  Corey and I fear for our safety, and we need protection to get this truth out.  To do this in the way Corey envisions it will take both time and money.  Firstly as a security measure Corey has already written down the names and details of the events and given them to a trusted person of power, in case anything should happen to him or any member of his family before the film is finished.  In order to make a true Hollywood Blockbuster these days the studios are spending upwards of $35,000,000 on average.  We are asking for much, much, less to make a top level quality film that will be guaranteed as a theatrical release.  

As we have seen no support as of yet, from the wealthy friends and peers we were so hoping would step up, it seems the lion share of the donations come from honest hard working people like ourselves.  For that reason we will not let you down, and not give up.  We will make this film no matter what.  As we were facing the reality of the lack of funding for the film we had in mind, Corey has reconfigured the scope of the production, and found a way to do the film for far less. Therefore as a way to keep things moving forward we are going to make a small budget version of the film, and are now seeking only 1 Million dollars for the production.  Corey has stated that if he can get at least $1,000,000 he can use that money to raise capital for the completion, and marketing, and distribution.  If we can achieve the new goal we can get the film made.  This makes our goal much more attainable, and much more realistic, so long as we all pull together in this last month.  Even if every twitter follower pitches in $10 we are there.  

With the $ we raise through this campaign we can pay for the films production, editing, marketing, and distribution.  This 1 time fee covers the whole process start to finish, while we go through this very difficult, painful, and scary process.  It will also cover initial legal fees.  Additionally, Corey believes this revolutionary approach to self financing and self distribution can reinvent the film industry and take away the power from those who now hold the keys to the world of Entertainment, which allows the power monsters to continue doing the things they have for so long.  This can truly be a way to regain control over who has access to children in the industry, while weeding out the criminals who have already caused the damage.  This is a call for the world to unite for a most important cause, to preserve the innocence of children.  Please do your part TODAY.

story:
Dear family and friends,

 

Quite possibly in the midst of a midlife crisis I’ve decided to something ‘adventurous’. I was looking for a mental and physical challenge that would also include some nature and culture.

Armed with a tent and a stove I will begin a 1 million step walk that will take me across India from east to west. I will follow the Kalveri river from where it empties out into the Bay of Bengal, right up to the source in the western hills 765 km’s. It will take around 6 weeks.

 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaveri

 

Mother India’s record for women’s rights hasn’t been all that positive, women’s rights are still an issue there and remain an issue globally. I’d like to also do this walk in honor of gender equality.

 

All donations will go to an organization called Mama cash . Mama Cash supports women, girls and trans people who fight for their rights, please find more information about the charity here :

 

https://www.mamacash.org/en/en-homepage

 

My goal is to raise at least 765 euros [the length of the river in km's]

 

Thank you for your time.

 

Christian

story:
Black Unity. Black Love. 

Black Safety. 

Black Community.  Black Wealth.

To upend the racial health, wealth, and opportunity gaps that keep millions of Black Americans from sharing in our country’s prosperity and realizing their personal potential we believe we must create a new community infrastructure that builds on egalitarian practices, innovative technology, and economic development with a focus on building Black businesses in an effort to create a thriving safe-haven for Black families that can be replicated across the United States of America and make a positive lasting impact for future generations.

We are the Freedom Georgia Initiative. We are 19 Black Families that own 502 acres of land in Wilkinson County, Georgia, 2 hours south of Atlanta. We are working-class families with different cultural roots across the African diaspora, looking to create a safe, fully functioning city for Black families who want to escape systemic racism and the trauma of being Black in America. 

On top of violence, the prison industrial complex, and health inequality, Black families are contending with a wealth gap that many experts attribute to Black land loss, discrimination in housing, and lack of access to capital when starting small businesses. The Freedom Georgia Initiative stands at the intersection of these challenges at this moment. We’ve exhausted our personal funds to make our vision for Freedom a reality with the acquisition of our land; yet, with a $500,000 performance bond we will be able to take the next steps in breaking ground and building the City of Freedom, GA. The financial obligations as large landowners, community builders, and first-time real estate developers are immense and even daunting; but this initiative is too important to stop now. 

If we do not secure the performance bond before August 1st, we could lose the 404-acre investment and the momentum built thus far significantly delaying our cityhood initiative.

This is where you come in. 

Today, we’re seeking partners who believe in our vision to join us in laying the literal groundwork of a city. Securing a performance bond of $500,000 will unlock the capital that the Freedom Georgia Initiative needs to complete the final civil engineering studies, create roads, lay fiber optics and renewable energy grids, stormwater runoff, and waste management systems, in advance of the residential homes and commercial buildings that will become the future City of Freedom! 

Some of the first projects that our future residents can look forward to include our solar farm to power the community with clean renewable energy, organic food farms with plant medicine nurseries, our assisted living elders complex, veterans affordable housing, tiny home subdivision, and our custom home subdivision called Pioneer Estates. Our vision for a SMART City is centered around health and wellness, featuring environmentally sustainable materials for maximum energy efficiency.

But we can’t get started without the performance bond we need to secure the project.  Big developers cannot be induced to build the healthy environmentally friendly neighborhoods we want and deserve for our people. No one is coming to save us from the status quo. We’ve got to do it ourselves.

The Freedom Georgia Initiative has only been able to get this far because we’ve worked together; 19 families and over 1,700 donors have already supported the creation of a thriving black safe haven. We are calling on you now to support our fundraising goal with whatever you can contribute. By investing in us, even with just a few dollars, you are investing in a better future for yourself and Black families everywhere. You are creating a space where generations of Black people, businesses, education, and arts will rise and prosper. 

We are establishing an innovative community for environmentally sustainable living, health & wellness, agricultural & economic development, arts & culture for generations to come. A replicable model or blueprint for other communities that prioritize the United Nations 17 sustainable development goals. A place where we beat the odds and cancel disparity. 

Join the Freedom Georgia Initiative today by making a tax-deductible (TBD) contribution of any size. Choose to invest in restorative justice and a community that will change the outcome of Black Lives for generations to come. It starts here, and it starts with you. 

If you can’t make a contribution today, please share our campaign with your friends, families, and allies directly and on social media. Every single effort and action you can take in sharing our campaign will make a difference. As our nation calls for an end to structural disparities, we ALL have a duty to examine the role we can play in stopping the perpetuation and fostering of institutional racism. 

About Us

Renee, Ashley, and Laura are mothers, wives, entrepreneurs, deeply spiritual, and committed people who want to create a thriving safe haven for our families and yours. An opportunity presented itself when the "City of Toomsboro for Sale" article went viral and it sparked the idea that we could create a place where the disparities don’t have to exist. Where we can determine for ourselves from the ground up the kind of place where Black families can thrive and not just survive the storms. A place called Freedom that can be a light tower and a beacon for hope to ALL. A place where peace, protection, and prosperity are centered as our core values for people and the environment. 

Other Press & Media

Insider: 19 Black families purchased 96.71 acres of rural Georgia land for a 'fresh start' with a Black-centric community

CNN: 90 acres in rural Georgia purchased as a safe space for Black people

Fox5Atlanta: Georgians strive to create 'Freedom, Georgia' as a 'safe haven' for Black families

While Black Podcast: A City Named Freedom w/ The Freedom Georgia Initiative

Fox News: Families aim to find 'safe haven,' build 'city of Freedom' for Black people on 97 acres in Georgia

More Information & Other Ways to Get Involved 

Sign Up Links - Get the Blue Print, Volunteer, or Relocate

Links to Socials

https://instagram.com/FreedomGA2020

https://facebook.com/FreedomGA2020

https://twitter.com/FreedomGA2020

Visit Our Youtube Channel & Subscribe!

 

THANK YOU TO OUR MASTER PLANNERS & RENEWABLE ENERGY TECHNOLOGY PARTNERS:

 

THANK YOU TO OUR FISCAL SPONSOR:

The Black Achievement Fund

A National Non-Profit 501c3 - 82-0856886 - You're Donation is Tax Deductible.
story_txt: Black Unity. Black Love. Black Safety. Black Community.  Black Wealth.To upend the racial health, wealth, and opportunity gaps that keep millions of Black Americans from sharing in our country’s prosperity and realizing their personal potential we believe we must create a new community infrastructure that builds on egalitarian practices, innovative technology, and economic development with a focus on building Black businesses in an effort to create a thriving safe-haven for Black families that can be replicated across the United States of America and make a positive lasting impact for future generations.We are the Freedom Georgia Initiative. We are 19 Black Families that own 502 acres of land in Wilkinson County, Georgia, 2 hours south of Atlanta. We are working-class families with different cultural roots across the African diaspora, looking to create a safe, fully functioning city for Black families who want to escape systemic racism and the trauma of being Black in America. On top of violence, the prison industrial complex, and health inequality, Black families are contending with a wealth gap that many experts attribute to Black land loss, discrimination in housing, and lack of access to capital when starting small businesses. We’ve exhausted our personal funds to make our vision for Freedom a reality with the acquisition of our land; yet, with a $500,000 performance bond we will be able to take the next steps in breaking ground and building the City of Freedom, GA. story:
Help us to save The Grain Tower

The Grain Tower, which has been decommissioned as a military building in 1956, remains derelict and unused till today. It’s been privately owned since 2005 but none of the owners did anything with this historically important building to bring it back to its previous glory.

Our aim is to restore it and made it available to general public as an observatory of diverse, local wetland bird population. Its tower, with several levels, will be perfect for both scientific and pleasure observation.

We strongly believe places like The Grain Tower should serve general public free of charge. Enough of these places have been turned into luxurious hotels which with its prices remain inaccessible to majority of us.

It is a designated Grade II listed building (from 1986) as well as a part of Scheduled Monument (nationally important historic building) – our aim will be to keep it accessible to general public and serve it in manner which will help preserving our flora and fauna.

There is a possibility of The Grain Tower being sold to the next owner before we will finish our collection (it is available to buy and we have to bear that in mind) – in such a case we will short-list 4 equally important and neglected sites and ask all the participants to vote for their choice.

What we need?

To buy and restore a building like this will not be easy and cheap. We want to start with the most important – buying and securing it. To keep a restoration in line with its requirements of the Great Listed building we will need at least £2,000,000 - but to buy it we will need £600,000. Every Pound, Dollar or Euro counts.

If you would like to see this building on Google Maps, please look for Isle of Grain and look into a Thames Estuary (coordinates 51.45168, 0.73125).

 Our long term plans:
 We would like to create a unique combination of research facilities and public attraction. Our research would mainly focus on one of the most important issues faced by this generation - changes to our climate. Nevertheless we would keep the facility open to public with no admission charge. In a long term we would like to create a chain of similar centres which would serve local communities as well as the researchers (all data would be made publicly accessible).
Yes, we realise the ambition of our plans - but at the same time, we believe that the valueu of this project speaks for itself, and if successful - it will benefit everybody, therefore it's worth every effort!

story:
This campaign is closed, but if you want to donate for our project, you can go to our Paypal account and help us to continue informing in Venezuela.

Esta campaña está cerrada, pero si quieres donar para nuestro proyecto, puedes ir a nuestra cuenta de Paypal y ayudarnos a seguir informando en Venezuela.

 

El Pitazo sounds where others are silent

(Más abajo en español)

We are a group of venezuelan, non-for-profit journalists. Many of us come from Media censored by the Government of Venezuela or even  blackmailed by local governments.

In December 2014, we created El Pitazo, a multi platform media outlet, with the objective of covering and bringing access to information to the most impoverished and marginalized peoples of our country.

The censorship has become more evident in light of the recent political events in Venezuela; it has been almost impossible to find out what is happening on the streets of our country through traditional radio and TV stations. In addition, it has become a high-risk challenge to come out and report on the latest protests, which means that the possibility of being informed has gained much more value.

El Pitazo is the only Media outlet with correspondents in the main cities of the country. That has allowed us to show a more complete view of the crisis and current events. No other digital native medium in Venezuela has raised, like El Pitazo, to reach the most disadvantaged population. That's why we say El Pitazo sounds where others are silent.  

We use alternative and innovative channels to reach our disadvantaged audiences which, for the most part, do not have smartphones and/or a steady Internet connection. In addition to web, radio and social networks, we use text messaging or SMS, informative video projections for communities in the outskirts of the cities, flyers and Whatsapp groups, and we also organize training workshops on citizen journalism in poor sectors of the country.

Our commitment has been rewarded with the incredible growth of our audience on all our platforms: we are among the first 10 native digital media in Venezuela and we have more than two million average visits per month on our website.

A protester expressed his displeasure loudly, on February 1, when the most recent street demonstrations in Venezuela began / Un manifestante expresó su descontento a viva voz, el 1ero de febrero, cuando iniciaron las más recientes protestas de calle en Venezuela. Photo Vanessa Tarantino

El Pitazo suena donde otros callan

Somos periodistas venezolanos y sin fines de lucro. Muchos de nosotros venimos de medios censurados por el Gobierno de Venezuela o chantajeados también por gobiernos locales.

En diciembre de 2014,  creamos El Pitazo  para hacer llegar a las regiones y a los sectores populares la información que ya se les estaba negando por la autocensura de dueños de medios de comunicación masivos.

Esto se ha hecho más evidente con las manifestaciones ciudadanas de los últimos meses, cuando ha sido casi imposible informarse de lo que ocurre en las calles a través de los medios tradicionales de radio y TV. Además, se ha convertido en un desafío de alto riesgo salir a cubrir las más recientes protestas, con lo cual el hecho de poder informar ha cobrado mucho más valor. 

El Pitazo es el único medio que tiene corresponsales en las principales ciudades del país. Eso nos ha permitido mostrar una visión más completa de la crisis.

Ningún otro medio nativo digital en Venezuela se había planteado, como El Pitazo, llegar a la población más desfavorecida. Por eso decimos que El Pitazo suena donde otros callan.  Nos valemos de innovadores canales para hacer llegar nuestros contenidos a una audiencia que en su mayoría no cuenta con celulares inteligentes. Además de la web, la radio y las redes sociales, usamos la mensajería de texto o SMS, proyecciones de videos informativos en las comunidades, perifoneo, volanteo y grupos de Whatsapp, y dictamos talleres de formación de infociudadanos en los barrios.

Este compromiso ha sido retribuido con el crecimiento increíble de nuestra audiencia en todas nuestras plataformas: estamos entre los primeros 10 medios nativos digitales en Venezuela y tenemos más de dos millones de visitas promedio al mes en nuestro portal

 

A venezuelan protester faces a “tanqueta” on the Francisco Fajardo highway, Caracas. /Manifestante venezolana se enfrenta a tanqueta en la autopista Francisco Fajardo, Caracas/ Photo Vanessa Tarantino​

Our team

César Batiz, Javier Melero, Gustavo Alemán, Yelitza Linares, Edecio Brito, Marjuli Matheus, Jesús Rivero Bertorelli, Jesús Alberto Yajure,, Gisela Rodríguez, Yves Briceño, Madelén Simó y Yéssica Sumoza, together with our 42 correspondents and photographers, we fulfill the great challenge that has become reporting in Venezuela. You can read more about who we are and our editorial policies on our website. 

 

Emmanuel Rivas, correspondent of El Pitazo in Mérida, in full task / Emmanuel Rivas, corresponsal de El Pitazo en Mérida, en plena faena / Photo courtesy: Jesús Quintero

 

Nuestro equipo

César Batiz, Javier Melero, Gustavo Alemán, Yelitza Linares, Edecio Brito, Marjuli Matheus, Jesús Rivero Bertorelli, Jesús Alberto Yajure, Gisela Rodríguez, Yves Briceño, Madelén Simó y Yéssica Sumoza, junto a nuestros  42 corresponsales y fotógrafos, cumplimos con el reto de informar en Venezuela. El gran valor de este medio es el talento de los periodistas que nos representan en cada región. En nuestro portal puedes ver quíénes son y cuáles son nuestros principios editoriales.

Vanessa Tarantino, photographer of El Pitazo, covering the protests in the freeway Francisco Fajardo, Caracas / Vanessa Tarantino, fotógrafa de El Pitazo, cubriendo las protestas en la autopista Francisco Fajardo, Caracas /   Photo courtesy: Francisco Bruzco

What do we need?


- We need US$20,000 that will allow us to cover one year of operation and honoraries for our 42 correspondents, while consolidating our business model.
- Every dollar you give to El Pitazo is the equivalent to two journalistic notes on our website.
- With a small contribution, you will be ensuring that a whole country is well informed.

¿Qué necesitamos?

- Necesitamos $20.000 que nos permitirán costear la operación y los honorarios de nuestros 42 corresponsales por un año, mientras consolidamos nuestro modelo de negocio.

- Cada dólar que dones a El Pitazo equivale a dos notas informativas en nuestro portal web.

- Con un pequeño aporte, estarás garantizando que todo un país esté bien informado.


A National Guard fires demonstrators in Altamira Sur, Caracas / Un Guardia Nacional dispara contra manifestantes en Altamira Sur, Caracas / Photo Rayner Peña​

The Panas of El Pitazo


You can donate from $5. It does not matter how much you collaborate with. That is what collaborative financing is all about, the small contributions of many. Our infinite gratitude is the same for all who share our cause. That is why we will offer the same reward for different donations: the possibility of accessing our network, Los Panas de El Pitazo, a group of friends committed to our project who are spread all over the world. For them, we will reserve informational privileges and permanent listening to their suggestions for improvement.

Los Panas de El Pitazo

Puedes donar a partir de $5. No importa el monto con el que colabores. De eso se trata el financiamiento colaborativo, de los pequeños aportes de muchos. Nuestro agradecimiento infinito va igual para todos los que comulguen con nuestra causa. Es por ello que ofreceremos la misma recompensa para diferentes donaciones: la posibilidad de acceder a nuestra red Los Panas de El Pitazo, un grupo de amigos comprometidos con nuestro proyecto que están regados por el mundo. Para ellos, reservaremos privilegios informativos y nuestra escucha permanente a sus sugerencias de mejora.

 

Citizens' march led by opposition MPs crosses El Paraíso, west of Caracas /Marcha de ciudadanos liderada por diputados opositores atraviesa El Paraíso, al oeste de Caracas. Photo Gustavo Alemán​

Other ways to help us


- Share this Indiegogo page on your social networks with the hashtag #ElPotazodeElPitazo #YoApoyoaElPitazo

. Write to elpotazodelpitazo@elpitazo.com if you have other ways to help us. 

Otras maneras de ayudarnos

- Comparta esta página de Indiegogo en sus redes sociales con la etiqueta #ElPotazodeElPitazo #YoApoyoaElPitazo

-Escríba a elpotazodelpitazo@elpitazo.com si tiene otras maneras de colaborar.

Es por ello que ofreceremos la misma recompensa para diferentes donaciones: la posibilidad de acceder a nuestra red Los Panas de El Pitazo, un grupo de amigos comprometidos con nuestro proyecto que están regados por el mundo. Para ellos, reservaremos privilegios informativos y nuestra escucha permanente a sus sugerencias de mejora. Citizens' march led by opposition MPs crosses El Paraíso, west of Caracas /Marcha de ciudadanos liderada por diputados opositores atraviesa El Paraíso, al oeste de Caracas. Photo Gustavo Alemán​
Other ways to help us
- Share this Indiegogo page on your social networks with the hashtag #ElPotazodeElPitazo #YoApoyoaElPitazo
. Write to elpotazodelpitazo@elpitazo.com if you have other ways to help us. Otras maneras de ayudarnos- Comparta esta página de Indiegogo en sus redes sociales con la etiqueta #ElPotazodeElPitazo #YoApoyoaElPitazo-Escríba a elpotazodelpitazo@elpitazo.com si tiene otras maneras de colaborar.

story:
THE CONGO TRIBUNAL

Ending impunity in Eastern Congo is an exhausting, tedious process. A comprehensive investigation of the mass crimes committed during the civil war has not been undertaken neither by national nor by international courts. Exploitation of the raw materials, which are irreplaceable for Western industries, continues to be accompanied by resettlement, conflict and violence.

For The Congo Tribunal, Milo Rau has assembled the victims, perpetrators, witnesses and analysts of the Congolese war in a unique civilian tribunal in eastern Congo. And what seemed impossible was achieved : all parties involved took part and testified in the publicly held tribunal.

For the first time in Congolese history, a protected public space was created in which the victims of displacement, expropriation, rape and murder were able to raise their concerns and accusations and have been heard by regional and national governments as well as by a local and international audience. The Congo Tribunal documentary tells this journey.

 

LET’S CREATE TWO, THREE, MANY CONGO TRIBUNALS!

Since the first Congo Tribunal, the victims of mass crimes and the civil society in the provinces of North and South Kivu continue to demand justice and an independent and impartial tribunal capable of applying the rules and principles of the law to a fair trial. In 2018, the internationally renowned lawyers Jean-Louis Gilissen,  victim’s representative at the International Criminal Court and chairman of the Congo Tribunal, and Sylvestre Bisimwa, Congolese human rights lawyer and prosecutor of the Congo Tribunal, intend to establish a continuous legal investigation of human rights violations at local level. The campaign „LET’S CREATE TWO, THREE, MANY CONGO TRIBUNALS!" is also supported by the Swiss Federal Councillor for Justice, Simonetta Sommaruga and the German Federal Judge Dr. Nikolaus Berger. We want to support the planned tribunals because we are convinced that they will help pave the way for peace!

THE GOAL of this project is to introduce and establish an institution, which reappraises the mass and economic crimes in local civil tribunals in the region.

 

LIKE AND SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN !

Twitter : @CongoTribunal
Facebook: www.facebook.com/thecongotribunal/

 

VISIT OUR WEBSITE

www.doctivism.org

 

PRESS

"The most ambitious piece of political theatre ever staged"  The  Guardian

"Where politics fail, only art can help"  Die Zeit

"All parties of the civil war in Congo take part in a symbolic and artistically visionary trial with two goals: peace and justice after twenty years of war"  GeoMovies​

"Part war crimes trial, part performance art: tribunal investigates Congo conflict" The  Guardian

"'The Congo Tribunal': Art taking over where justice fails"  Deutsche Welle

"Filmmaker Puts Congo Mining Firms on 'Trial'" VOA News

 

MAKERS, ACTIVISTS & SUPPORTERS

"There must be no lawless rooms for them. A tribunal, such as that Milo Rau in Congo, can give . a voice to the victims. This is important, for it is a first step against impunity" Simonetta Sommaruga, Federal Councillor for Justice (CH)

(Photo- FDJP, Sebastian Magnani)

 

“The Congo Tribunal Project has been able to open the door to justice in Congo. In order to ensure that the project has a lasting effect, the positive reception of the vision of a real tribunal in Congo must now be supported from here. It is, of course, not only about the responsibility of Congolese actors, such as the government in that country and the armed gangs, but also about the responsibility of Western states, international organisations and transnational corporations.” Wolfgang Kaleck, founder of the European Center for Constitutional and Human Rights (ECCHR) and jury member of the Congo Tribunal (GER)

(dpa/picture-alliance/Jörg Carstensen)

 

“The Congo Tribunal” is an urgent and necessary project. It is urgent because it allows us to rehabilitate parts of our humanity by giving a voice to those whose rights have been violated. It is necessary because, in the absence of national and international justice, only a public discussion will advance the urgent political debate on the responsibility of transnational corporations for human rights.” Chantal Peyer, Head of the “Business and Human Rights” department, Bread for all

(photo All rights reserved)

 

"I support the Congo Tribunals because they can help the congolese people to regain lost hope for justice. The Congo Tribunals can strengthen civil society's efforts to condemn human rights violations in the civil war regions" Dr. Nikolaus Berger, Judge at the Federal Supreme Court (GER)

story:
We're looking to raise enough funds to start with 10 Inflatable Standup Paddle Boards and PFD's to start taking groups of teen girls on sponsored body-positive paddleboarding trips.

Girls on Boards is on a mission to build confident female leaders.

More girls on boards (paddle boarding for strength and body trust) can have a direct correlation to bring more girls on boards (leadership positions in business).

Why Girls On Boards?

  • 53% of 13-year-old North American girls are unhappy with their bodies. This number grows to 78% by the time girls reach 17.
  • As early as the preteen years, girls start to withdraw from activities such as giving an opinion, going to school, going to the pool, etc. because they feel bad about how they look. 
  • By middle school, 40-70% of girls are dissatisfied with 2 or more parts of their body.

Why Stand Up Paddle Boarding?

When you're out on the water, paddling your own board and soaking up nature you stop worrying about how you look, and you start to feel gratitude for your body and the places it can take you. 

Taking groups of teen girls out on paddle boards, off of social media, away from cameras and into nature to feel the power of their own bodies.  Learning to love what their body can do for them, where it can take them.  Feeling their strength, connecting and balancing their core.  Opening discussions on what they love and what they love doing and where they want to go.  Away from mirrors and pressure.  

What are we Offering?

Sponsored & Guided Paddle Boarding excursions for groups of 10-15 girls.  Initial offerings will be in BC west coast (Vancouver area) and NS, east coast (Halifax area) Canada.

Body empowerment and self-confidence exercises.  Conversations & opportunities to share in a safe environment.

What We Need to Get Started

  • 10 Inflatable Stand Up Paddle Board Sets  & PFD's ($5000 USD)
  • Messaging and Marketing to Teen Groups (focus on teens dealing with eating disorders). Sponsored trips starting in Vancouver, BC and Halifax, NS
  • Volunteers: Insured and certified Stand-up Paddle Board leader. 

 

Who will we be taking?

- associations with waiting lists. (Currently creating partnerships)

- sign up form on our website.

- high school programs.

Vancouver:

http://www.bcchildrens.ca/our-services/mental-h...

http://www.lookingglassbc.com/

Halifax:

http://eatingdisordersns.ca/

http://www.cdha.nshealth.ca/mental-health-and-a...

USA:https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/about-u...

Canada :https://www.eatingdisorderhope.com/treatment-fo...

 

How will Girls On Boards Continue to Support Sponsored Trips?

In alignment with our purpose to continue to offer sponsored trips for teens seeking body positivity support, GirlsOnBoards.co will be offering paid trips for women and corporate groups.  Each paid group trip will sponsor a teen trip.  Attendees of our GirlsOnBoards retreats will be offered Paddle Boarding adventures built to inspire, build confidence and a supportive community of women looking to grow in life and leadership.  

 

Who is the Team behind Girls on Boards?

Mia Lockhart

  • mother of 4 children, 2 being teenage girls currently.  
  • survivor of a teen eating disorder.
  • Top 'Women in Tech' & 'Parenting' blogger on Medium.
  • empowerment mentor to many teens and women in business.

I want to Thank You for Your Support in Bringing this Dream to Life!

 

Check out The Perks of Donating to this Campaign!

T-Shirts

*All sizes available!  Jade's wearing an x-small here.

Original Design T's for the Girls on Boards Campaign are being created and curated by: runwildchildco.com.  Amazing shirts, service, and support!  Thanks Ash

story:
Churches Improving Communities (CIC) connects the resources of faith communities - expertise, funding, volunteers, and buildings - with communities in need to improve the lives of hundreds of low-income NJ residents each year via various programs:

  • NeighborCorps Re-Entry Services, providing support for people returning to their communities from jail;
  • Church-Based Mental Health Services, providing free and low-cost professional mental health counseling and education at 7 locations in 4 NJ counties; 
  • CALTR Faith in Action, a volunteer-based service-learning program that rehabilitates homes for low-income families, including those impacted by Hurricane Sandy, and families for whom an affordable rent means the difference between having a home and being homeless; 
  • New Jersey Congregational Center for Cancer Care (NJ CCCC), a new program that responds to the complexity of cancer in our families and communities through individual, congregational, and systemic engagement, support, and advocacy; and
  • D.I.R.E. Support Services,  proactive community Deportation & Immigration Response team dedicated to ensuring the human rights and well-being of non-citizen individuals and families in which there are U.S. citizen children living with non-citizen parents.

 

100% of donated funds go directly to support the staff and programs that make this work possible. Because CIC partners with faith communities for free building space and a large cadre of volunteers, our program overhead represents just 6% of our total annual budget.

In this campaign, we are offering alternative gifts for the holidays. Use the "perks" on the side to chose a particular item or program to donate towards--like counselling costs, sheet rock, and phone services.  It's a wonderful way to give in honor of friends and family! Each donation will come with a personalized card for you to give to your loved ones to let them know what was donated in their honor.

Two of our programs are in early stages, so we are directing the funds raised for them in specific ways. Funds donated to DIRE will go towards legal services for low-income individuals, including minors, who require immigration lawyers.  (A typical case starts at $10-12,000. Most families are barely keeping their children fed and housed.)  All donations for New Jersey Congregation Center for Cancer Care will go towards its inaugural year, as we develop programs and hire an executive director.  For each of these, you can choose your level of giving.

 

Your financial support makes a direct impact on the lives of the most vulnerable in New Jersey, people like: 

  • Ralph, who, despite living in a shelter since his release from jail, was able to receive resume and job interview assistance from NeighborCorps staff and volunteers, and was recently offered three jobs in the same week! Because of the support of this program, he will soon be able to move from the shelter into an apartment and continue to rebuild his life post-incarceration.
  • Or Bob, a homeowner from Union Beach, who was underinsured and unable to repair his family's home after Hurricane Sandy, and who was able to move back in to a fully functional, safe home thanks to volunteer labor and donated supplies through CALTR.
  • Or the hundreds of individuals who receive counseling, attend support groups, or participate in mental health education and awareness events each year through Church-Based Mental Health Services, including people who cannot otherwise access services due to prohibitively high insurance deductibles, providers who are too far away for individuals with limited transportation options, or providers with a months-long waiting list for clients to even be seen.

 

CIC also utilizes the arts and healing arts to uplift individuals and communities who may benefit from the arts as a way to tell and shape their own stories, as well as to bring the social issues of communities we work with to a larger audience through the arts. Our arts partnerships include:

  • coLAB Arts to bring awareness of social issues to a broader audience through theatrical and dance performances;
  • local yoga studios to bring a yoga program into Middlesex County Jail, into a residence for young women aging out of foster care, and to bring trauma-informed yoga training to people involved in helping professions in our community;
  • the Visual Arts Center of New Jersey, whose teaching artists will be conducting an "art as autobiography" course for inmates;
  • and Windows of Understanding, a public art partnership with The New Brunswick Community Arts Council, Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University and the Highland Park Arts Commission, whose theme was "We See Through Hate," a response to hateful political rhetoric.

 

CIC relies on the generosity of faith organizations, foundations, and individuals like you to make this work possible.  Please donate today!


Classis New Brunswick Community Development Corporation (doing business as Churches Improving Communities) is a 501c3 non-profit organization. All programs are non-discriminatory and open to the public.

When life hands you lemons, make blankets! 

I want to make blankets for the homeless so that no one will have to be cold and lonely. I know that I cant save the world but I do want to make a difference in the sphere of people that are around me. 

My name is Jackie Russell and I came up with this idea to make blankets for the homeless a few weeks ago after I had a life altering summer. I was really going through a time where I wanted encouragement and support. I just wanted to know that I was loved and supported by the people around me. While I was in this state of mind, I came across a few people who happened to be homeless and were asking me for help. I didn't have any money at the time so I felt completely hopeless in this situation but I did want to help. All I could think was that I may not be able to offer money right now to help but I can offer my talents to help. 

That moment birthed this campaign to make blankets for the homeless. With the simple gesture of offering someone a blanket in the cold, I believe it can show that love and support. I just want to show the homeless people in my area that they are loved and cared for.

 

All I really need is a donation of $5 in order to make this idea a reality. 

So this is the breakdown of the cost. 

I will be making 15 - 20 chunky blankets starting in September till the end of November to give to the homeless of my city. I have decided to use the most cost effective brand (to my knowledge) of chunky yarn for the blankets and that is Bernat Blanket Yarn. (The link for the yarn that I will be purchasing is: http://www.hobbylobby.com/Yarn-Needle-Art/Yarn/...) 

This yarn is about $5 a skein and the yarn weight is a 6 so it is classified as super bulky. I will be making blankets the size of a normal throw blanket, which will call for 12 skeins of the Bernat. 

1 Blanket: 12 skeins x $5 = $60

10 Blankets: $60 x 10 = $600

15 Blankets: $60 x 15 = $900

20 Blankets: $60 x 20 = $1,200

 

What will a blanket do? 

Your contribution will give someone who is living on the street a since of warm and home in the upcoming colder months.

I know that this is a hard concept to grasp the impact of giving to someone who is crocheting blankets for the homeless but I think about it like this... if I was on the street and if someone came to me and gave me a blanket that they made just because they wanted to show me love, it would warm my heart to know that someone cares. 

That is what I am trying to do. Simple enough. I want to show that I care.

It is less about the blankets but it is more about showing people that they are loved, accepted and cared for. It is about showing people love during this holiday season when they may not have family or friends around them. 

Wont you consider contributing to this effort. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You don't have any money to contribute?

  • Share this link to a friend or family member. 
  • Donate yarn!
  • Take out your crochet hook and help me make blankets.

story:
The world is moving to digital currencies. It is the future of money. In this new digital world, governments and corporations intend to track every transaction to supplement all the other information they collect about us. There are many reasons to be concerned about these developments. In this cashless society and the social credit system, anyone could be punished for not playing by the rules, including being completely banned from the system. Without access to this system, such a person would not even be able to beg for money on the street. And that is just one of many terrors of this dystopian nightmare that is awaiting us. It is unavoidable unless We The People create our own digital money. If not, we will lose our privacy and freedom.

 

What Is Money

Cryptocurrencies were created to compete against the fiat money. However, with over a decade after the invention of bitcoin, cryptocurrencies are no closer to producing functional money. Clearly, cryptocurrencies have a fundamental problem that prevents them from being adapted in the economy. The reason is that the cryptocurrency enthusiasts insist a cryptocurrency like bitcoin is money because it is a unit of account, a medium of exchange, and a store of value. While bitcoin undoubtedly has these properties, they are derivative properties, not definitional properties.

Money is defined by the relationship between money and goods, where: “Goods are wealth which you have, while money is a claim on wealth which you do not have. Thus goods are an asset; money is a debt.” Money is a debt obligation, a type of security best-known as a note, such as the Federal Reserve Note.

Since money is a security, and commerce requires securities to operate, explains why cryptocurrencies failed as money.

 

Equitable Money

If debt is money and it is the type of money we have, then something else must be the problem, and if we don’t fix it, then switching to a different type of money by itself will not help.

The problem is that we have two economies. A productive economy that produces everything, and the unproductive economy of the financial sector that speculates in the financial markets. Money created for the productive economy is used to produce goods and services. While money created for the financial sector is used to extract money out of the productive economy. At the same time, the financial sector has expanded over the last 100 years from 5% of the GDP to over 50%. Moreover, the financial sector misuses the power of money creation for its own benefit. For example, the central banks are now using the QE program to rescue the banking system by creating enormous amounts of money at the expense to the productive economy.

If money were issued as debt to the productive economy, then there would be no such problems. But asking the financial sector to get out of the business of money is a nonstarter.

 

 

Axio Monetary System

The Axios Foundation is developing an independent monetary system based on diametrically opposite principles to the current system, such as public control and transparency for common good instead of secrets for private gains. It would be able to function within the global economy and able to compete against the fiat money. It would be a real revolution against the establishment, and it is already under way. It is called the Axio Monetary System.

The system will be operated by the Foundation in a similar way to a credit union, which is a financial cooperative controlled by its members as stakeholders, and operated on the principle of people helping people. The System will be based on a cryptocurrency called Axio that will be issued by the Foundation and will be held in accounts managed by the Foundation. All axios will be issued as Axio-denominated loans. Each Axio will be created as a loan and will be destroyed when it is paid out. This process of creation and destruction of the Axio will be secured with a blockchain. Consequently, the amount of Axio in circulation will be able to expand and contract in proportion to the demand for the Axio, while assuring that the Axio is fully backed by the full faith and credit of the borrowers. That is, the Axio will be directly backed by the intrinsic value of work that represents the real value rather than a by-product of work such as gold. And unlike commodity-backed cryptocurrencies that have a fractional reserve value, the Axio will be fully backed by the full faith and credit of the borrowers.

The System will include a bank, a currency exchange, and a dispute resolution system. These institutions will provide the minimum required to allow the Axio to function within the economy. The System will provide services such as payment methods that will support free real-time transactions, enabling the Axio to compete against other currencies. All this will give the Axio many advantages over other cryptocurrencies, including a stable intrinsic value that does not depend on other currencies or commodities, free real-time transactions paid for by the interest on loans, legal basis of a security issued under the law, in addition to many other advantages the Axio Monetary System will offer. 

Backed by its own monetary system, the Axio can be thought of as a currency of a virtual country, and will be usable just like any other currency via a payment app or a credit card. The Foundation will support business transactions by providing a legal framework supported by dispute resolution. The ability to redress grievances will make the Axio similar to a government-issued legal tender, which is something that no other cryptocurrency can offer. With so much going for it, the Axio is positioned to become a dominant player in the race to create the next generation of money. As such, it has enormous potential.

 

 

We The People

The Axio Monetary System could provide a core of a new economy that would serve the people and resist the dystopian future that awaits us. To implement this system, the Foundation needs to raise $20M, of which a U.S. bank license is approximately $15M. Then it will take a year to develop the infrastructure. For this the Foundation issued 100,000,000 Axio Tokens that will be converted into Axio when the Foundation will begin its operations. As a U.S. corporation, the Foundation is required to raise funds in accordance with the SEC regulations. As a result, the Axio Tokens are only available to accredited investors, which effectively excludes the majority of people. At the same time, venture capitalists are mostly interested in acquiring an equity state in the company, while the Foundation will belong to its members. And all investors are interested in a company that already raised significant capital.

To move this project forward, we need to fund a much larger campaign. If we can raise $5M, we will start the implementation of the project. If you wish to invest, please contact the Foundation.

Most of all, this project needs grassroots support. We all need to pull together, we must seize this moment and act boldly to tackle the profound inequality created by the financial sector. Continuing with the status quo is not an option. So get involved and spread the word. The time is now to do what the government and the financial sector won’t; create a monetary system of the people, by the people, and for the people.

Make your choice!
Join the revolution!

 

For more information about the Axio Monetary System, please visit the Axios Foundation website. For an overview please refer to the Pitch Deck, with further information disclosed in the Blog, Whitepaper, Business Plan, Executive Summary and the Axio Token Terms of Sale.
story_txt:
The world is moving to digital currencies. It is the future of money. In this new digital world, governments and corporations intend to track every transaction to supplement all the other information they collect about us. There are many reasons to be concerned about these developments. In this cashless society and the social credit system, anyone could be punished for not playing by the rules, including being completely banned from the system. Without access to this system, such a person would not even be able to beg for money on the street. And that is just one of many terrors of this dystopian nightmare that is awaiting us. It is unavoidable unless We The People create our own digital money. If not, we will lose our privacy and freedom. What Is MoneyCryptocurrencies were created to compete against the fiat money. However, with over a decade after the invention of bitcoin, cryptocurrencies are no closer to producing functional money. Clearly, cryptocurrencies have a fundamental problem that prevents them from being adapted in the economy. The reason is that the cryptocurrency enthusiasts insist a cryptocurrency like bitcoin is money because it is a unit of account, a medium of exchange, and a store of value. While bitcoin undoubtedly has these properties, they are derivative properties, not definitional properties.Money is defined by the relationship between money and goods, where: “Goods are wealth which you have, while money is a claim on wealth which you do not have. Thus goods are an asset; money is a debt.” Money is a debt obligation, a type of security best-known as a note, such as the Federal Reserve Note.Since money is a security, and commerce requires securities to operate, explains why cryptocurrencies failed as money. Equitable MoneyIf debt is money and it is the type of money we have, then something else must be the problem, and if we don’t fix it, then switching to a different type of money by itself will not help.The problem is that we have two economies. A productive economy that produces everything, and the unproductive economy of the financial sector that speculates in the financial markets. Money created for the productive economy is used to produce goods and services. While money created for the financial sector is used to extract money out of the productive economy. At the same time, the financial sector has expanded over the last 100 years from 5% of the GDP to over 50%. Moreover, the financial sector misuses the power of money creation for its own benefit. For example, the central banks are now using the QE program to rescue the banking system by creating enormous amounts of money at the expense to the productive economy.If money were issued as debt to the productive economy, then there would be no such problems. But asking the financial sector to get out of the business of money is a nonstarter. 

 
Axio Monetary SystemThe Axios Foundation is developing an independent monetary system based on diametrically opposite principles to the current system, such as public control and transparency for common good instead of secrets for private gains. It would be able to function within the global economy and able to compete against the fiat money. It would be a real revolution against the establishment, and it is already under way. It is called the Axio Monetary System.The system will be operated by the Foundation in a similar way to a credit union, which is a financial cooperative controlled by its members as stakeholders, and operated on the principle of people helping people. The System will be based on a cryptocurrency called Axio that will be issued by the Foundation and will be held in accounts managed by the Foundation. All axios will be issued as Axio-denominated loans. Each Axio will be created as a loan and will be destroyed when it is paid out. This process of creation and destruction of the Axio will be secured with a blockchain. Consequently, the amount of Axio in circulation will be able to expand and contract in proportion to the demand for the Axio, while assuring that the Axio is fully backed by the full faith and credit of the borrowers. That is, the Axio will be directly backed by the intrinsic value of work that represents the real value rather than a by-product of work such as gold. And unlike commodity-backed cryptocurrencies that have a fractional reserve value, the Axio will be fully backed by the full faith and credit of the borrowers.The System will include a bank, a currency exchange, and a dispute resolution system. These institutions will provide the minimum required to allow the Axio to function within the economy. The System will provide services such as payment methods that will support free real-time transactions, enabling the Axio to compete against other currencies. All this will give the Axio many advantages over other cryptocurrencies, including a stable intrinsic value that does not depend on other currencies or commodities, free real-time transactions paid for by the interest on loans, legal basis of a security issued under the law, in addition to many other advantages the Axio Monetary System will offer. Backed by its own monetary system, the Axio can be thought of as a currency of a virtual country, and will be usable just like any other currency via a payment app or a credit card. The Foundation will support business transactions by providing a legal framework supported by dispute resolution. The ability to redress grievances will make the Axio similar to a government-issued legal tender, which is something that no other cryptocurrency can offer. With so much going for it, the Axio is positioned to become a dominant player in the race to create the next generation of money. As such, it has enormous potential.  We The PeopleThe Axio Monetary System could provide a core of a new economy that would serve the people and resist the dystopian future that awaits us. To implement this system, the Foundation needs to raise $20M, of which a U.S. bank license is approximately $15M. Then it will take a year to develop the infrastructure. For this the Foundation issued 100,000,000 Axio Tokens that will be converted into Axio when the Foundation will begin its operations. As a U.S. corporation, the Foundation is required to raise funds in accordance with the SEC regulations. As a result, the Axio Tokens are only available to accredited investors, which effectively excludes the majority of people. At the same time, venture capitalists are mostly interested in acquiring an equity state in the company, while the Foundation will belong to its members. And all investors are interested in a company that already raised significant capital.To move this project forward, we need to fund a much larger campaign. If we can raise $5M, we will start the implementation of the project. If you wish to invest, please contact the Foundation.Most of all, this project needs grassroots support. We all need to pull together, we must seize this moment and act boldly to tackle the profound inequality created by the financial sector. Continuing with the status quo is not an option. So get involved and spread the word. The time is now to do what the government and the financial sector won’t; create a monetary system of the people, by the people, and for the people.Make your choice!Join the revolution! For more information about the Axio Monetary System, please visit the Axios Foundation website. story:
In 2010, Séverine and Baptiste visited Goma as consultants for the Ministry of the Environment of the DRC and the Agence Française de Développement. Experiencing this war-torn region first hand left a tremendous impact on them. The dedication, professionalism, and fearlessness of their local contacts impressed them profoundly. Séverine and Baptiste vowed to return and they kept in touch with local activists over the past few years. 

Today, they are returning. Séverine, now a law school graduate in New York, and Baptiste, a strategy consultant in Paris have founded the Rwando-Congolese dialogue (“Dialogue Rwando Congolais").


A Voice For Underrepresented Constituencies in Rwanda and Congo

The Dialogue aims to ensure that underrepresented constituents, including youth groups and grassroots organizations, are heard. After a 3-day Dialogue, 12 young men and women from Congo and Rwanda will issue recommendations that Séverine and Baptiste will disseminate to the international media, the United Nations, international organizations, and the political leadership of both countries.

If you choose to support us today, you will help six Rwandese and six Congolese, young professionals, students and activists, design a common vision for the Great Lakes Region, across borders. The Dialogue will be held in Goma, DRC from August 21 to 23. Locally, Pascal Mugaruka, who runs Africa Reconciled in Congo, and Furaha Hakizimana, from Ejo Youth Echo in Rwanda, are the Rwando-Congolese Dialogue’s representatives. 

How to Sponsor the Rwando-Congolese Dialogue

We are asking for your help to raise the $6,000 necessary to make this Dialogue possible from August 21 - 23, 2015, in Goma, DRC. Your money will support the following:

- 12 participants Transportation, Visas, Room & Board at Hotel Caritas (http://en.hotelcaritasgoma.com)
- Closing Reception with Local Officials
- Séverine & Baptiste’s Transportation, Visas, Room & Board
- Miscellaneous (car rental, office supplies, emergencies)

As our sponsors, you will be regularly updated on all the Dialogue’s plans. You will also receive copies of the recommendations that emerge from the Dialogue and will remain informed about any follow-up initiatives.

The Rwando-Congolese Dialogue Timeline

April

Participants have selected three themes on which to issue their recommendations:

- Cultural: Leveraging shared cultural identities in the Great Lakes Region towards reconciliation
- Political: Bridging the communication gap between civil society, regional, national and international institutions
- Economic: Enhancing economic opportunities for 18-35 year olds – educational adequacy, women empowerment & entrepreneurship.

June / July

- Participants draft reflections on the selected themes in preparation of the Dialogue.
- An International Experts Panel on the Great Lakes region helps in framing the issues. Experts are from academic and international organizations, including the European Union, the G7+, Columbia University, New York University, Swiss Peace.

The Dialogue in Goma, August 21 to 23

- Creating a safe space for participants to share their past experiences through role-playing and cultural sessions.
- Providing conflict resolution and communication / media training.
- Leveraging creative thinking techniques and facilitated breakout sessions.
- Sharing the recommendations with local and international stakeholders at the Dialogue’s closing ceremony.

Why We Believe in The Dialogue

The positive feedback that Séverine and Baptiste have received across the board concerning the Dialogue has been encouraging and has strengthened our determination

The young women and men who will participate in this Dialogue are taking personal risks and we expect their courage to be reflected in the recommendations resulting from this Dialogue. We will make their voices heard.

 When we traveled to Goma in 2010, a local activist, who expected us to come back, told us, "Don’t worry, we are together!" – "On est ensemble".  

If you are interested to know more or engage directly with them, feel free to contact Séverine (slosembe@gmail.com) or Baptiste (b.p.raymond@gmail.com) directly.

story: As teachers in a multi-cultural community we work with many children from migrant and refugee families. Our hearts go out to those waiting to cross the border in Calais. We are collecting clothes, tents, sleeping bags and food to take over, but we know that organisations working on the ground out there will need cash donations too, to get them through the winter months. For those of you that want to support what we are doing, this is a way of showing your solidarity. No donation is too small! Every pound will go to supporting refugees and migrants in the Calais camps.
