story:
Did you know that  In the last several years, a local FBI task force recovered over 400 girls being sold for sex?  The youngest was eleven years old.  However, due to the fact that this is such a hidden crime, this number grossly understates the size and scope of the problem.  In addition, teen pregnancy is on the rise and cyber bullying among girls is ever increasing. 


These issues are pressing and we won't stay silent! 

We believe that girls can empower other girls by leading with LOVE and compassion. We host G.L.A.M. Camp events across the country to empower girls to BE THE CHANGE that's so desperately needed.


G.L.A.M Camp for Girls, Inc. is a not-for-profit overnight event for junior high and high school girls who want to ROCK their communities for CHANGE! 


**College aged girls (18-23) also attend and serve as “ big sisters” and mentors.

 

We are a leadership camp that empowers girls and promotes multiculturalism through many different artistic and creative means.  We strive to gather girls from all ethnicities, socio and economic backgrounds so that they can come together to make a difference in their communities.  They can impact their generation and BE THE CHANGE by leading with LOVE and compassion.  

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Our 2015 Camp takes place in SACRAMENTO, CA at The Life Center/Hyatt House Hotel

 If there is a girl in your life who fits this criteria, a leader, loves her community and wants to make a change, G.L.A.M. CAMP is for her! 

BUT WE NEED YOU!  WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO MAKE IT ALL HAPPEN!

We don't want to turn girls away! We need your help to make camp happen at minimal cost or even FREE for girls who desire to attend!

Girls attending camp will leave empowered and confident! The camp addresses God-confidence, self-esteem, leadership, discovering true identity, how to gain freedom from peer pressure, how to write out and complete life goals and action steps toward them, how to make healthy choices in life, spiritual development and so much more!

Girls will get to participate in team building sessions, LIVE concerts, archery and a host of other fun activities! Our camps will host amazing artists and speakers and fun activities such as makeovers, goal setting, vision casting, and pajama parties! It will also be focused on leaders of that region and preparing them to inspire and love their generation!

Our West Coast Camp will be held this year in Sacramento, CA  November 13th – 14th, 2015 and our East Coast Camp will be held at Camp Letts in Roberta GA. We would be honored to have your support for girls to be trained in leadership to reach their  local community!

 All of the funds will go to provide lodging, camp programming, all meals and activities. We would like to provide 100 scholarships for girls to attend!

Your support will help ensure the success of our West Coast and East Coast events! 

 Please visit our website at www.glamcampforgirls.org/sponsor to find out more information on the lives we are impacting or visit us on social media.

Twitter: @glamcamp4girls

Instagram: @glamcampforgirls

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/DGGGlamcamp

Other Ways that YOU Can Help Girls get to  GLAM Camp!

We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about this empowerment campaign!  You can do this by using one  of your social media outlets, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to encourage people to check out our movement and what we are doing with young girls. 
  • Please share this campaign with 3 people:  someone who might want to volunteer, someone who has a heart for seeing young girls as visionaries and might want to give a financial gift and a young girl who who could use this camp experience.  We want to be the change we are seeking in this generation and we believe LOVE is the anecdote for change!

Please share this campaign with 3 people:  someone who might want to volunteer, someone who has a heart for seeing young girls as visionaries and might want to give a financial gift and a young girl who who could use this camp experience.  We want to be the change we are seeking in this generation and we believe LOVE is the anecdote for change!

story:
“She Survived” is a short documentary about the domestic violence epidemic across the globe, focusing primarily on violence against women. It is inspired by the director’s own experience with violence in her home as a child. 1 in 3 women will experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime and this film aims to inspire discussion and action to stop this toxic culture.

Domestic violence has been a part of culture, religion, and life since the beginning of time. This film will focus on the historical aspects of violence that influence the way men act toward women today. Domestic violence is a cultural issue, and this film aims to target the promotion of violence against women in society.

Cinematographer Andrew Porter and Director, Judi Polanco have teamed up to make this documentary a reality.  

“She Survived” will inspire change in the hearts of viewers. It hopes to bring awareness and give the audience guidelines to follow in order to prevent any more pain. It is time to stop the violence and listen to those who haven’t been listened to in a long time.

How you can be part of the team:

Now, we need $15,000 to help with the renting of necessary equipment, editing and finishing costs.

Other ways to support the cause:

Any contribution helps. If you aren't able to make a donation, you can forward our campaign to others and spread the word on social media.

story:
Notre campagne de financement est à présent terminée mais vous pouvez toujours verser un don sur notre compte bancaire .
Plus d'infos: www.humans-welcome.be/support
 

Chaque matin, lorsque nous prenons notre tasse de café, dans la nuit d’encre précédente, des enfants et des adultes boivent la tasse en Méditerranée, pauvres corps flottant entre deux eaux, dans un cri inaudible tendant la main vers les hommes politiques européens, des millions de réfugiés s’entassent dans des camps de fortune.

La Crise du Projet Européen, pauvreté, no future, rejet, repli identitaire/extrême droite/totalitarisme conduisent à la banalité du mal (Hannah Arendt). Le mal ne semble pas affecter les décisions schizophrènes de l’Europe contre les Droits de l’Homme…

Des citoyens se mobilisent pour permettre aux réfugiés d’accéder aux droits les plus élémentaires de sécurité, de dignité auxquels tout être humain a droit. Nous demandons plus de justice, nous sommes tous des exilés, aucune civilisation n’a résisté en érigeant des murs.

Le projet sur la route des réfugiés s’inscrit dans cette volonté de créer une conscience commune en partant de l’ile de Lesbos (Grèce) pour rejoindre le parlement (caprice des dieux… grecs) à Bruxelles en courant 3.000 km avec des slogans révélateurs de l’irresponsabilité du monde politique européen (Human’s Welcome) et en apportant à nos dirigeants européens un message des réfugiés séjournant en Grèce, ainsi qu’en soutenant les citoyens grecs désespérés (qui est le laboratoire de l’Europe de demain).

Quels sont les objectifs ?

  • Rencontre avec les réfugiés/autorités et peuple grec, artiste Wei Wei/ONG, recevoir leurs messages (en attente des mobilhomes: aux environs du 03/04/2017);
  • Soutien des associations locales en Grèce œuvrant pour l'accueil et l'intégration des réfugiés;
  • Départ de Grèce avec les 3 équipes le lendemain de l’arrivée des mobilhomes aux environs du 05 avril 2017 et arrivée au parlement Européen le 16/04/2017;
  • Parcourir ± 120Km/jour/mobilhome x 3 = 360km durant ± 10 jours (les 3 équipes courent en même temps mais pas ensemble et se retrouvent le soir);
  • Partager cette conscience dans le voyage en encourageant les habitants (des villes que nous traversons) à courir un peu ensemble (Humans Welcome);
  • S’arrêter si possible devant les barbelés/frontières en maintenant une minute de silence/brassard noir du deuil;
  • A l’arrivée en Belgique (si possible beaucoup de coureurs rejoignent la caravane pour arriver à Bruxelles), interpeller les hommes politiques européens avec le message transmis par les réfugiés et le peuple grec (demander le soutien de parlementaires européens);
  • Déposer sur le parvis, un zodiac avec les photos de Humans Welcome et des gilets de sauvetage;
  • Par la suite, projections du voyage/démarches dans les écoles !

À quoi serviront les dons récoltés via cette campagne de financement ?

Les dons serviront dans un premier temps, à financer les coûts de location, ainsi que les différents frais connexes, des mobilhomes afin d'accompagner les coureurs, dans la remontée, vers le Parlement Européen à Bruxelles en Belgique.

Au delà des 15.000€, les dons iront à des associations œuvrant pour l'accueil et l'intégration des réfugiés.

Les frais personnels des coureurs ne sont pas pris en compte dans le montant de notre campagne de financement dans la mesure où ceux-ci sont pris en charge par les coureurs eux-mêmes.

Grâce à vous, nous serons leurs pas, leurs voix... Merci pour eux !

Homeless Helping Homeless, an organization on the front lines battling homeless hate laws in Tampa, FL was recently raided by police. Documents and passwords were seized and all residents and visitors were given four days to vacate. Homeless Helping Homeless is in immediate need of funds to house the evicted homeless and to obtain another facility that can withstand local government attacks and code violations.

The political backlash against the houseless community and those challenging homeless hate laws has spread to a beacon of humanity in our Tampa community. Homeless Helping Homeless’s houseless operated facility has carried on its work of welcoming folks regardless of ability to offer a dime, for a number of years with the full knowledge of the city and Tampa police department. That is, until they won a lawsuit challenging the city’s anti-panhandling laws – and with another suit pending, the city followed up by sending 16 police cars to the Homeless Helping Homeless Floribraska facility in the morning hours of September 3rd to raid, seize passwords, search the grounds and give folks 4 days to vacate the premises. We as a community have challenged outdoor food-sharing bans, panhandling laws, police brutality, and a host of other ordinances that have (and were meant to) do nothing more than make houseless persons’ activities of daily living impossible – even criminal, all to cater to folks more fortunate.

Homeless Helping Homeless is in immediate need of funds to house those evicted and to obtain another facility that can withstand local government attacks and code violations. Homeless Helping Homeless is the only emergency shelter in Hillsborough County that allows homeless men and women, who have no money, job or government vouchers to stay longer than five days in a facility. They provide, lockers, showers, beds, help with i.d.’s and birth certificates, hygiene kits, meals, free laundry, numerous other services and show that the houseless community is not looking for a hand-out, they are extending their own hands out to help lift up others. Homeless Helping Homeless does incredible work for our community. It’s time for us to return the favor. Please consider donating generously to support these efforts by and for homeless individuals to empower and help themselves in the face of governmental repression.

For more information about the raid click on the links below:

http://www.abcactionnews.com/news/crime/homeles...

http://tbtpics.tampabay.com/news/publicsafety/c...

https://philanthropy.com/article/Tampa-Homeless...

And please check out the Homeless Helping Homeless website at http://www.homelesshhh.com/

story:
Hello!  Meet Joseph Frank.  Minister, husband, father, community leader.  Joe lives in NE PA, US with is wife and three of their children.  Joe works tirelessly to see that as many as possible are fed, clothed, and housed in the surrounding community.  

Our passion for this ministry stems from seeing the faces of those who are accustomed to working hard all their lives, and losing their jobs, or becoming disabled, etc...  We work hard to limit the shame, and hopelessness people feel when their futures are threatened by providing food, clothing, helping them find resources  for all their needs. Here is how you can help us help others.  

On February 28th Joseph was returning home from work in the very early hours of the morning, when a delivery truck crossed the center line, hitting his van, stranding him in -12 degree weather.
While Joe was only shaken up, the van is now wrecked.  This was the only transportation he had to haul food to the pantries he services on a weekly basis.  Without these deliveries, we cannot meet the needs in the area.  We were working to fix the van, but have since found that the open trailer we normally used for hauling food, was not sufficient according to law.    We must use a closed-in one from now on.
Can you help?  Our need is for a new/used closed in trailer to haul food for the pantries we service.  You and you alone can help bring some joy and dignity to those who have been suddenly deprived of their ability to provide for themselves and those they love.  We always encourage those we help to pay it forward.  So your contribution will go on to help many more than just those we see on a weekly basis.
We have been working with a trailer manufacturer to get the best possible price for the trailer we need. $7000 will cover a 7 x 16 ft closed-in trailer needed to haul the food for all the pantries.  This is the best price since it is direct from the manufacturer.  We have much faith that our goal will be reached, but if we don't reach our goal, the monies will go into a ministry account to be saved until we can raise what we need.
We do understand that there are those who cannot help financially.  We would like to ask that you spread the word.  Pray if you pray. Tell everyone you know!  The more people who find out about our needs, the more who can help us, and maybe they will go out and help others themselves.  You can use the sharing tools on the site to send this out to your friends and family.  Thank you so very much!

story:
Did You Know?

  • An estimated 140,000 veterans live in government shelters; half of these have service connected disabilities.

  • The number of vets returning from Iraq and Afghanistan who were homeless on any given day in 2013 was 50,000.  Many of these vets were also diagnosed having PTSD.

  • In any given year, veterans represent a disproportionately higher rate of unemployment than the general public.  

Surprised?  So were we.  And we want to make a difference, but we need your support.    

                         


Here's How We Got Started:

We are two Army veterans passionate about helping our needy military heroes. We have over 60 years business experience between us and have decided to combine our talents to launch a business that will: 

  • Hire veterans, including those with disabilities

  • Donate funds to benefit needy veterans

Because a large share of our experience is in chemical processing, we chose to start a company that will eventually manufacture and sell its own line of liquid products as well as provide mixing and packaging services to other businesses.  We, the owners, will not be taking any salaries for the foreseeable future.


              STEPS TO A SUCCESSFUL MISSION

 
We plan to accomplish our mission in stages.  We have formulated our  product offering, which includes a line of eco-friendly solutions.   We carefully chose our supplier and have purchased our initial product inventory.  This initial selection will be broad enough to satisfy our customers' basic needs.  Additional products will be added based on customer preferences and available funds.  We are in the process of securing our client base and preparing marketing materials.  While we have been using our own money to fund operations, we can't do it alone.  As funds are made available through operations and contributions from you and others, we will be bringing in-house as many production processes as we can. Eventually, we will not only be producing and packaging our own products, but we will be offering contract filling and packaging services as well.



Our Products

Our product line consists of a full range of janitorial cleaning and maintenance chemicals, including a line of earth-friendly products.  Included are: disinfectants, sanitizers, degreasers, drain openers, hard-surface floor care products (cleaners, strippers, finishers), carpet cleaners and spotters, liquid soaps, detergents, deodorizers, stone & grout cleaners, and all-purpose cleaners (APC).  Depending on the specific product, container sizes range from 32oz to 5 gallon.  Some products are ready-to-use (RTU) and others are concentrated.  Our product formulations have been used for many years and have proven to be as effective as any major brand name. 




What We Need

The most efficient and quickest approach to get to market is to initially have our products manufactured by a third party.  The margins are lower with this option, but we will be able to generate cash flows earlier, thereby lessening the amount of external funding needed.  The earlier cash is generated, the earlier we can acquire equipment and accelerate hiring.

Our initial needs are primarily for working capital.  Expenditures we have incurred to date, excluding inventory, include rent, deposits, insurance, utilities, website creation, office supplies, and promotion material.  The total of these is just over $9,000.   Because our company is new, we are not eligible for regular payment terms from our suppliers.   Also, as standard industry practice, our supplier has a minimum quantity order requirement for each product.  The first shipment cost $16,500.  Other anticipated ongoing expenditures include freight, marketing, and sales commissions.


The Impact

It is our passion to help the veteran community.  We are hoping that potential customers will know that, by patronizing our products and services, they will be joining us in giving back to those who have given us that peace of mind, that freedom which is all too often taken for granted.

Our labor force will be made up of veterans, some with service disabilities.  We strongly believe that those who have served our country deserve more than just a pat on the back.

We are especially proud of the fact that our company will allocate 10% of all profits as donations to needy veterans.  We are partnering with Intrepid Fallen Heroes Fund and Homes for Our Troops, both 501(c)(3) non-profit volunteer-based organizations, funded entirely by private donations.  We chose these two charities as their missions are honorable and their administrative expenses are minimal relative to their donation revenues – a clear indication that they are truly dedicated to their cause.  They are both top-rated by third-party charity auditors.

                  


Risks & Challenges

Based on our experience in liquid contract manufacturing and in business management, we know that this can be a success.  As the business grows, so does the number of our veteran employees and the amount of donations made by the company in support of needy veterans.

Our biggest hurdle is funding.  Up to now, we have been using our own money to fund operations.  However, we need your support to continue our mission.  We are not technically a charity and therefore cannot receive grants from Foundations. Furthermore, angel investors are typically not interested in funding businesses having a charitable slant.    


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can use one or more products that we carry.  And if you know others who may be interested in purchasing our products, by all means please mention us.  These people may also have connections, directly or indirectly, with one or more of our primary customer targets:  janitorial cleaning services, nursing homes/assisted living facilities, hotels/motels, medical buildings, office buildings, government buildings, restaurants, banks, and schools.

And remember, if you see a vet, thank them for their service!

a minimum quantity order requirement for each product.   The first
shipment cost $16,500.  Other anticipated ongoing
expenditures include freight, marketing, and sales commissions.




The Impact 
It is our
passion to help the veteran community. 
We are hoping that potential customers will know that, by patronizing our
products and services, they will be joining us in giving back to those who have
given us that peace of mind, that freedom which is all too often taken for
granted.
Our labor
force will be made up of veterans, some with service disabilities.  We strongly believe that those who have
served our country deserve more than just a pat on the back.
We are
especially proud of the fact that our company will allocate 10% of all profits
as donations to needy veterans.  We are partnering with Intrepid Fallen Heroes Fund and Homes for Our Troops, both 501(c)(3) non-profit volunteer-based organizations, funded entirely by private donations.  We chose these two charities as their missions are honorable and their
administrative expenses are minimal relative to their donation revenues – a
clear indication that they are truly dedicated to their cause.  They are both top-rated by third-party charity auditors.
                   



Risks & Challenges Based on our experience in liquid contract manufacturing and in business management, we know that this can be a success.  As the business grows, so does the number of our veteran employees and the amount of donations made by the company in support of needy veterans.
Our biggest hurdle is funding.  Up to now, we have been using our own
money to fund operations.  However, we need your support to continue our mission.  We are not technically a charity and therefore cannot receive grants from Foundations. Furthermore, angel investors are typically not interested in funding businesses having a charitable slant.    

    Other Ways You Can HelpMaybe you can use one or more products that we carry.  And if you know others who may be interested in purchasing our products, by all means please mention us.  These people may also have connections, directly or indirectly, with one or more of our primary customer targets:  janitorial cleaning services, nursing homes/assisted living facilities, hotels/motels, medical buildings, office buildings, government buildings, restaurants, banks, and schools. And remember, if you see a vet, thank them for their service!

story:
About Sanctuary Homes Crowdfunding Campaign

Hate groups and people who threaten or harm others are growing. These groups and people are located around the world and continue to recruit and grow in number. Today, hate groups in the USA are the highest in 20 years. Unfortunately, there are very few technical innovations to help victims protect themselves against these acts of hate.

 

Radius helps those being threatened or who live in fear of these acts by providing them a mobile app that can quickly locate sanctuary locations near them. By simply clicking a button, users can locate any sanctuary home or sanctuary business near them. All sanctuary locations have been vetted by the local community they live in. Radius does not monitor or collect any data with its sanctuary services and our servers will be located in countries that protect the rights of our members. Surrounding privacy and security, our members' personal information is treated with the highest priority.

 

Is Sanctuary Homes and Sanctuary Businesses ready to use in the Radius mobile app now?

 

Sanctuary Homes and Sanctuary Businesses; privacy focused, locally vetted, sanctuary homes and other sanctuary locations.

 

We have completed phase 1 of Radius and it’s now live. Here’s a list of what Radius provides now.

- Sanctuary Homes & Businesses — helps those being threatened or hurt by quickly locating safe places near them

- Allows anyone with a home office the ability to share it with other members who are local and need a place to work (think AirBnB, but for shared home office space)

- Helps volunteers, activists and nonprofits work and network together

- Provides all members a team creation tool for team projects and a jobs directory where individual and team work projects will be posted

 

Radius is free for all users and we intend to keep it that way. It’s for everyone to use, even if you have no money. In order to keep these services free we need to build phase 2.

 

This crowdfunding campaign will build Phase 2, allowing us to not require outside funding and continue providing free sanctuary services

 

Radius has completed phase 1, allowing us to bring sanctuary services, home office share, job tools, and a job directory to our members. It took us over 2 years to build phase 1 because we basically had zero funds, forcing us to work at a very slow pace. The funds raised by this crowdfunding campaign will allow us to build phase 2 of Radius which include education and mentorship services, a person-to-person payment gateway to receive and send funds, Smart Contracts for work projects, Blockchain to support the services above, and more. Once Phase 2 is complete, Radius will be completely self-sustainable, allowing us to continue providing free services to all members.

 

 

Allocation of campaign funds used

 

All funds will be used to build phase 2. We anticipate this period to be 12-14 months, starting from the time this campaign ends. Funds will be used for;

 

65% > Technical development; programmers, tech project management and other specialty skills

25% > Server hosting and data storage - servers/tech will be located in countries that protect our members privacy, not the demands of bully countries

10% > Legal and support services

story:
Welcome to Remedy Georgia. We are a farm-to-table catering company built on the foundation of a job training program for under-served women and survivors of trafficking. We were NOT created FOR these women but BY these amazing resilient women. From the very beginning, Remedy Georgia has been a co-creation solution, providing local fresh food and assistance with rebuilding lives.

There are many expenses involved in such an endeavor, so these #StandFor1100 funds are much needed to expand our work. We are in the process of preparing for our next program starting in March, which includes new kitchen facilities to manage hands-on training and scaling box lunch catering.

We stand with these girls & women as they transform there lives, will you join us and support our campaign?

Join Us To Be The Remedy!

- Trina, Jinean and ENTIRE Remedy Georgia crew!

Jinean Robinson + Trina Braxton
 

 

Remedy Georgia FEATURED @ Plywood Conference (Community Leaders L to R, Aneesah Allen, Jinean Robinson, Founder, Charlotte Robinson, Dr. Kemberly Edwards, Executive Director)

_________________________

The Problem

Georgia fluctuates between the #1 and #3 state for the exploitation of girls under the age of 18.

This equates to 100 girls sold for sex every night in the state capital, Atlanta, alone.

Girls and women who have made the tough decision to escape this life are overwhelmingly unable to secure gainful employment. Remedy aims to fill this reintegration gap. In addition, we’re created to prevent girls from being exploited in the first place. In the face of this landscape, we launched Remedy in April 2013 to provide much needed prevention & reintegration support.

What can 100 people do to assist Remedy Georgia?

100 people donating $10 will support one woman that has chosen to participate in our holistic job training program. Remedy Georgia focuses on exploitation prevention by providing a summer program for underserved girls and programs throughout the year for the women that these girls grow into that are now choosing to proudly step out of this life. It costs a little over $1000 to put a participant through the 8 week Training Program. In 8 sessions, participants are trained to put the outcome of their future in their own hands. Each woman receives the tools to build their leadership, career and a business, plus the opportunity to help run Remedy Georgia, a farm-to-table catering company.

Now imagine $10 doubled, tripled, even multiplied by 10. When you choose to partner with a contribution of $10 or more, you choose to put more women through the training program.

Whatever you decide to give, even $10 goes to supporting the goal.

Will you #StandWith100 by backing us today?

 

 

_________________________

How Remedy Started

In 2010, our founder, Jinean Robinson spoke to a group of young sex trafficking survivors that left her with a lasting impression. She embarrassingly admitted she expected to see girls who looked and acted beyond their age. Instead she saw coy young ladies that looked and acted like her beloved nieces. On the ride home she reflected on how they chatted about dreams and aspirations and how those innocent girls were no different than her nieces or her at that age.

Over the next few years Jinean set out to learn about this issue called “human trafficking” She traveled to conferences around the country, met with experts, supported the 27 million movement and worked with survivors at The Well, a safe-house in Mexico City, MX. During the extensive period of research, Jinean learned her hometown of Atlanta ranked between #1-#3 of cities exploiting girls under 18, she vowed to make an impact at home. Limited resources caused a narrow focus on intervention and rehabilitation with little attention to prevention and reintegration of survivors, so she decided to fill that gap with a social enterprise.

Jinean worked with a pilot group of founding member survivors from Wellspring Living, the largest live-in aftercare facility in the US for survivors, birthed Remedy. Our team grew into a family of community and survivor leaders dedicated to partnering with underserved girls and women as they build a better life.

A stall in fundraising efforts in 2015, had us go dark for two years. In this time, we’ve continued to work with Remedy Graduates and unfortunately have had to turn potential participants away. We REFUSE to give up and with faith and a network of people across the world supporting us we are boldly relaunch, join us donate now!

_________________________
 

The Remedy Georgia Vision

We are creating a world were the community has fresh food options and women that were once violated, triumph.

_________________________

Why Remedy?

Think of that moment in YOUR life that someone stood with you. Had that not made that choice you KNOW you would not be where you are. This is YOUR opportunity to pay it forward.

With a shoestring budget, like $1500 startup ;), we’ve created miracles with 25 graduates, 35 women touched, 5 farmers supported, 40 Community Leaders engaged and overall direct impact of over 500+ ppl. Imagine what we’ll do when we raise this $100,000!!

_________________________

Risks & Challenges:

We want to be 100% transparent that we understand to be sustainable we must get regular funding and a strong base of catering clients. We are limiting the programs to 5 women until 10% of our catering profit equals the cost of the program. With focus on business healthy lunch and learn catering niche we will build clientele to be best of the best. We are not pie in the sky and have discussed annual retainer with corporate partners, to allow for minimum revenue to sustain and grow.

_________________________

The Remedy Georgia Team


Jinean has a proven track record as a creative director with brands like Gatorade, McDonalds, Verizon and more for over 15 years, she is considered an expert in design for social innovation and  co-founded of TwitChange, first Celebrity Twitter Auction.  She also is a One Club Winner Guinness Book World Record holder for most money raised on Twitter, and a proud board member of GA Cares. She’s the wind beneath our wings to drive results!

Dr. Kemberly Edwards is our Executive Director and long time committed community leader.

Kem is a visionary leader and educator with 15+ years of experience with K-12 education. She has applied this expertise in successfully and effectively managing programs mentoring women locally and with travels to Ethiopia for sex-trafficking prevention initiatives. Bottom line, Kem rocks!

Cayana Mackey is our project manager and #StandWith100 Rally Co-ordinator.

Cayana keeps us on our toes with her passionate zeal for project management and development. She has sprinkled her magic “get-it done dust" working with Habitat for Humanity International, Carolina Youth Development Center and Urban League of Chattanooga as well!

_______________

Our awesome advisors:

Trina Braxton, BarChix Owner
Barbara O'Neill, Founder and owner of Cookie Studio
Dr. Jeanette K. Miller, Corporate Finance, Business Analytics and Entrepreneurship, Oglethorpe University
Means Davis, Business Success & Personal Empowerment Empowered-Enterprises
William James Long, Reliance Advisory Group

_________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean YOU can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. You can STILL stand with us!
  • Download our digital toolkit here. Please blast all your digital peeps with the StandWith100 Remedy Georgia message!
  • You can use Indiegogo share tools on this page to share with friends!

story:
Tight-Knit Syria is a small not-for-profit that works with a collective of twenty-five Syrian artisans in Shatila Camp, Lebanon, to introduce their beautiful hand-made items to the many consumers around the world who love ethically sourced items with a story. In this way, needlework allows our collective to earn an additional income for rent and medical care; to allow their children to stay in school instead of working; to get productive, and to seek each other out to knit together or learn new techniques, which eases some of the anxiety and loneliness of life in exile. But Tight-Knit Syria is a small organization, whose impact could be many times bigger if we had the resources to impact more families and allow our artisans to take a hand in running their own business. The women of our collective have gone from refugees to artisans. With your help, they can go from artisans to entrepreneurs, in 3 steps:


 

 

 

 

Perk Breakdown: 

10% : material costs + admin fees 
15%:  wage to artisan/per unit
75% :  funding the mission 

 

                                   

 

 

 

VIDEO CREDITS

Videographer: Michelle-Girouard

Footage via: Jaron Soh

Footage via: Zain Adris 

Graphics via: Claire Stanley

story:
JOIN THE GLOBAL RESISTERHOOD DURING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AWARENESS MONTH!

From now until Friday, October 27, donate to Global Rights for Women's (GRW) annual fall fundraiser to become our partner in promoting the human rights of women and children locally and internationally to be free from violence. It is our hope that this celebration will be a pivotal moment of GRW's leadership growth. In addition to ticket and table sale goals, we hope to raise an additional $50,000 from partners like you in order to elevate our efforts to: ​

  • Offer seminars and local events
  • Write research papers
  • Provide compensation to victims of domestic violence
  • Give voice to survivors of violence
  • Enhance our project in Georgia
  • Launch a webinar series
  • Continue to hold law enforcement workshops for violence against women

 

THE GLOBAL RESISTERHOOD!

On Friday, October 27, GRW will host its 2017 celebration dinner - Global Rights for Women Presents: The Resisterhood! 

The fundraiser will focus on the intersections of the varied experiences of women and girls. It will feature women of diverse backgrounds and influence in their respective communities. They will speak about the status of women's human rights in the world. In addition to emcee Dessa and musical performers, the speakers will explore how the subjugation of women and girls is connected to marginalized groups globally - highlighting the growing understanding of the intersectionality of oppressions. They will stress how GRW's mission "to promote women's human rights to equality and freedom from violence through legal reform and systems change" is a critical component of a healthier, more just world for all.

Resisterhood emcee, speakers, and performers

 

SUPPORT THE GLOBAL RESISTERHOOD

More than 600 million women live in places where domestic violence is not considered a crime, and violence against women and girls continues at pandemic levels around the world. According to the World Health Organization, 35 percent of women worldwide have experienced physical violence, and 30 percent of women who have been in a relationship report that they have experienced some form of physical and/or sexual violence inflicted by their intimate partner.

Violence is an enormous barrier to women achieving independence, vitality, and full participation in their communities. Because of violence women suffer isolation, inability to work, loss of wages, lack of participation in regular activities, and limited ability to care for themselves and their children. Violence against women can lead to depression, post-traumatic stress disorder, sleep difficulties, and eating disorders. Violence  leads to injuries, unintended pregnancies, and sexually transmitted infections. It results in homicides and suicides.

Please partner with GRW to increase its budget so that we can meet the growing demand for our services  and continue to promote the human rights of women and children locally and internationally to a life free from violence. 

And consider purchasing one of our new "End Gender-Based Violence" t-shirts here! 

 

ABOUT GLOBAL RIGHTS FOR WOMEN

GRW is a Minnesota-based organization dedicated to promoting women’s human rights internationally through effective legal and systems reform on violence against women and girls. Founded in 2014, we work to develop systems to combat violence by partnering with organizations around the world to enact and enforce laws, create sustainable training initiatives, build local advocacy and public support, and monitor implementation of law, policy, and practice.

GRW was founded with the belief that this is a remarkable time for women and girls in our world, and that it is within our reach to build a world where women's human rights to equality and freedom from violence are fully realized. Our Minnesota legacy positions us as a uniquely effective force in fulfilling our mission. Minnesota’s history of social change, its extraordinary leadership to end violence against women and its vibrant international human rights community have provided an exceptional platform for global participation and influence.

Our Vision

Global Rights for Women envisions a world where women’s human rights to equality and freedom from violence are fully realized.

Our Mission

Global Rights for Women collaborates with partners around the world to promote women’s human rights to equality and freedom from violence through legal reform and systems change.

For more information, visit our website: grwomen.org.

story:
Maimonides writes that the highest form of Tzedaka is to help others earn a livelihood on their own, Like giving someone a fishing pole and not the fish. 

We strengthen businesses withing Judea and Samaria (ie West Bank) by providing them with the tools to expand their reach and more effectively compete and grow. With more an 60% of job growth originated from small local businesses, the strength of these communities of Judea and Samaria is reliant on them, the businesses.

With your help, will continue to flourish and grow our economy in the face of opposition from groups like the BDS Movement, the UN anti-Israel Resolutions,  and countless other international bodies and organizations whose aim is to use economics as a weapon against the Jewish people's rights to live in their ancestral homeland.

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

1) click on the above "Back it" button and contribute.

2) Become an advocate for the people of Judea and Samaria. Tell your friends, family, colleagues and community leaders about this campaign and let's connect. 

3) share this link on social media channels. Tell your 'friends' that you took part in this campaign and they should as well.

4) If you are a retailer, distributor or business person who would like to lend their knowledge and expertise, please contact us. 

 

4 staged plan:

Stage 1: Upgrade local business directory

Currently listing over 2600 businesses and estimated in bringing in more than $2 million to these businesses, an upgrade will enable us to increase our number of visitors, increase engagement in create a spike in new revenues to these businesses. 

Stage 2: Creation of an E-Commerce Shopping Mall

200 e-commerce shops for 200 businesses located within Judea and Samaria promoted under one banner. Using technology developed in-house, each of these businesses will have their own independent responsive e-Commerce website both in Hebrew, for domestic consumption, and English for international consumption.

Stage 3: Increasing Export Opportunities

Forming partnerships with government export institutes in developing new marketing and sales channels for businesses currently exporting to retailers and distributors domestically and globally.

Stage 4: Develop Opportunities for foreign investment

Develop and promote foreign investment opportunities for those seeking to take part in the economic development of Judea and Samaria.

 

CALL TO ACTION!

If you remain a supporter for Jewish rights and sovereignty sub sit on the sidelines and do not take any action, too much will be at risk to be lost. 

If you take action as a supporter for Jewish rights and sovereignty, we will win. When we work together, nothing can stop us. 

Please click on the above "Back it" button and contribute whatever you can.

story:
The Issues

First Amendmentware Inc. has been established to develop and support software that guarantees a universal human right - Freedom of Speech.

This fundamental human right, the right to share ideas without fear, is under attack through corporate and government censorship.  Our mission is to make the free exchange of ideas available to every man and woman on the planet using the most powerful digital tools available.

Right now, most people face censorship from the age-old Tyrannical Triad: Monopolistic Business, Government tyranny, and Religious hegemony.

Over 6 billion people are not afforded freedom of speech rights to any real degree. Of the 3.7 billion people on the Internet as of today, the vast majority are not able to express an opinion without fear of retribution in the form of intimidation, persecution or even death.

The positive side of this dilemma is that there is massive untapped human potential available, if people were only able to express themselves, share ideas and get their story across in a censorship resistant, fully anonymous (if the author so chooses) environment.

We believe there are “10,000 Galileo's” who are yet undiscovered. There are infinite breakthroughs in medicine, science, discussions that should be held on philosophy, religion, human wisdom and new ways of thinking about age-old problems just waiting to be shared.

Our platform will enable these people easy access to a forum where ideas and solutions can be found for mankind, without fear of persecution.

We strongly believe the human race is on the verge of a new Renaissance, if the free exchange of ideas can be facilitated in a way that liberates the author, and the proponents of ideas, from undue persecution.

If conversations can be established, then ideas can be freely debated in the marketplace, fresh solutions, and some old ones, can be found and adopted based on merit. Opposing ideas can be debated in a virtual Stadium, without fear.

With the Prototyping Freedom project, they can be.

The Solution

Our vision of this new freer, safer world is both bold and achievable!

The blockchain, most often associated with disruptive business models, establishing new paradigms in banking, finance (e.g. Bitcoin), record keeping and supply chains, is now about to find itself hosting a brand-new solution to an ancient problem.

First Amendmentware Inc. is going to establish the world's first human rights blockchain application suite, specifically focused on freedom of speech.  We will be literally prototyping freedom of speech on the blockchain.

This will enable people to publish their viewpoint, books, articles, blog posts and eventually via the full range of media. This will include work-a-likes for Twitter, YouTube comments, Facebook, and others, all without the current censorship constraints limiting open and honest dialogue.

First Amendmentware Inc’s publishing platform is about to become disruptive to all sorts of censorship and tyranny, because every person has the right to express their opinion without fear.

With your donation, First Amendmentware Inc. will establish a software platform and market the solution extensively to liberate human discourse in a way never seen before.

Our system will not only facilitate the liberty of speaking freely on issues our members find important, but would enable ‘wealthier’ members to sponsor that author in the Sudan, assist the citizen journalists from Paraguay, or help a blogger from Detroit. The platform enables continued giving amongst the members to assist one another, so that the recipient stories can be told.

The system has enough beneficial attributes baked into the design to enable it to effectively become an economy within itself. This is an economy of ideas, with transactions serviced by tokens called NOVOs.

The NOVO has 3 primary goals:

  1. Be the default service token for all digital publishing interactions
  2. Facilitate publishing free from fear via anonymity within repressive environments
  3. Dethrone the tech giants by replacement and circumvention via a purely democratic digital media model

 

In general, the NOVO’s purpose can be said to be the engine of complete decentralization, democratization, and simplification of value exchange for digital content published without fear.  It also allows you to "sponsor" authors anywhere, anonymously if you so desire.

 

 

Why not shift part of your tax burden to Prototyping Freedom?

First Amendmentware Inc. is a non-profit, US- based  501 (c)(3) organization, so all donations are 100% tax-deductible.

This legal status as a non-profit gives First Amendmentware Inc. a unique advantage in terms of affordability and financial advantage for donors and contributors. All donors are able to observe their money providing freedom of speech to ever increasing user database, whilst contribution models being tax deductible.

In addition to a 100% tax deduction, donors will also receive “NOVO coupons”, good for NOVO tokens when they are minted.

If it costs you nothing, but creates Freedom for people all over the world, why not get involved?

 

The Team

Roger - CEO

Roger’s technical roots in radio engineering, and then creating and managing diverse non-profit social groups and organizations. Working as a London based head hunter and then moved into structuring and managing significant finance and capital investment for traditional, non-traditional, and disruptive technology ventures

Ann - Director

Ann is our senior director and native of West Virginia. She completed a degree in organisational psychology, spent time in the Marine Corps, and has taught martial arts. Following her service, she focused on developing a career in medical administration, and currently performs CEO-level functions and support for one of America’s medical facilities. Ann brings to the team a genuine sense of compassion for people from all walks of life, and a strong set of organizational skills.

Bill - CTO

Bill has a  lifelong career in system software, and his professional background ranges from building real time mission critical flight control systems, production cryptographic banking facilities, banking security systems procedures, and now blockchain dapps and smart contracts.

 

Donations sought

We are raising USD$100,000 to create our prototype platform and basic application functionality. We can also accept donations of two crypto-currencies: Bitcoin and Ethereum.

In subsequent funding rounds we will raise additional funds based on this prototype to fully establish the base platform, spend more on marketing (including foreign languages) to establish awareness and a strong donor base.

The team will be hired (both in-house and external contractors as well as volunteers) to assist with the execution of this plan in the most efficient time frame possible. 

There is no direct competition for our platform, so there is no alternative to achieve greater freedom through the blockchain. Our non-profit platform will sustain a series of technology additions and improvements, based on the foundational truth that everybody has the right to share opinions without fear. All other systems are commercially driven and/or truncated around one feature. We will provide a suite of freedom of expression tools that will forever expand the borders of human discourse on a non-profit basis.

First Amendmentware is here for the long-term because human freedom wasn’t established in a day. It takes enduring courage, commitment, and leadership passionate about the cause, Freedom of speech for all.  We will move forward regardless, but your help will move us forward more quickly.

We have done the initial hard parts, establishing the non-profit, recruiting the executive team, and designing the software.  Now all you have to do is donate, and the wheels really start to turn on this game-changing human rights project.

Please donate generously and assist us as we create a legacy of freedom for ourselves and future generations.

story:
In 2018, a law was changed which allowed for medicinal cannabis to be prescribed on the NHS for a number of conditions. This was a triumphant moment for patients who use cannabis to treat their conditions, as it was the first indicator that they would no longer be prosecuted for simply treating their condition.

 

Since that triumphant moment, very little has changed. Only a handful of patients have been able to access legal cannabis through the NHS.

 

Instead, cannabis has become a two-tiered system. Those who can afford a private prescription can receive their medicine legally and those who cannot face prosecution, and a potential prison sentence. 

 

The situation is stuck at an impasse. Medicinal cannabis is legal, yet patients who have valid conditions that are recognised by doctors are still forced to buy cannabis illegally. 

 

Patients are stuck. They are living in fear on a day-to-day basis that they might get arrested for simply treating their conditions.

 

This can't go on, and here is the solution:

 

Cancard is a collaborative project between patients and police to help stop needless arrests or interference for consuming cannabis medicinally.

 

CanCard is a holographic photo ID card. Designed in collaboration with GPs and verified at the patient's surgery. The card is for people who qualify for a legal prescription but are unable to afford one.

 

It allows patients to feel safer when carrying cannabis. 

 

Patients simply go to their GP, have their condition noted and submitted into a database which corresponds with their card. If questioned, the patient presents their card to the police officer who will have been briefed to feel confident in using their discretion where it is presented. Every police force in the UK will be briefed on Cancard and advised to leave patients in charge of their medicine. 

 

If a police officer decides that they would still like to prosecute, CanCard is still here to help with an online portal of legal advice. We can’t always solve the issue, but we can create a proactive dialogue between patients, their doctors, and the police.

 

CanCard has already received the backing of MPs, it is supported by senior police officers and has been designed with doctors.

 

We need your help to get this off the ground. Your money will go towards: 

 

- Helping us to build a platform to facilitate the automation of application to delivery of Cancards

- Help us to subsidise the cost for those who are on low income or benefits 

- Help us to build a supportive patient forum for patients and GPs to connect and exchange information and advice 

- Build a resource platform that will be free for patients to use who may have suffered a charge

story:
Short Summary

Octavia Ethridge is an emerging filmmaker based in Los Angeles, CA. Born in Aiken, SC, Octavia grew up fascinated by film and theater. She started writing her first feature film when was 15 years old and ever since then, she has continued to write short films, TV shows and feature films she has yet to make. Octavia decided to take the journey of filmmaking by first, joining the Marine Corps and serving 4 years to earn her free education to attend The Los Angeles Film School where she is focusing on directing for her bachelors degree. A director and screenwriter of various genres but mainly drama, she focuses on uplifting women, social injustice, and fighting the odds of normality by reversing roles and creating original content that are based on issues people face in society. She is an activist for equal rights, justice, lgbt rights and women empowerment, in which, she is continuing this exploration with "Stand Up for Something", which is her most personal project yet.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help with making this film so that we can spread the awareness for civil rights, lgbt rights and women empowerment. 

Locations: $4000

Craft service: $500

Crew: $3500

Post Production: $700

Equipment: $1000

Cast: $1500 

Costume and hair/ Make up: $2000

If we do not reach our goal, the funds will still be used but more towards the location and equipment needed.

The Impact

Being involved in this film means that you believe in equality and justice across the board. This film  can make a huge impact and change many lives of so many people dealing with the issues we deal with today. Cops killing people, LGBT community prejudice and the stereotype of black men and women can all be changed and seen throughout this film. This film can bring forth a new path of dealing with these type of situations instead of how we handle them today and thats by love seen in this film.

Octavia has brought great success with awareness to women empowerment with her latest short film/music video, Nice for what. See link below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdYdY7U0Vt

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help contribute by donating and spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends and family and all across social media. Thank you so much for standing up for something.

story:
Short Summary

In today's world what could you get in 20 cents? Probably something random off eBay or Amazon. It may also be useful as a paperweight. But what if you could feed an underprivileged person in just 20 cents?

The inception of Feed, Pray, Love began on the haphazard and dreary streets of my colony when I began to notice that there were far too many around me who were going to bed with an empty stomach. There were kids roaming around in tattered and unkempt clothes, labourers exhausted after a hard day of work and women who had toiled all day long at both in and out of the household and each one of them had one thing in common: their desire for a satisfying meal. That's all. 

At first I began sending fruits to the nearby school for the underprivileged everyday. However, the knowledge that I was still not doing enough would gnaw at me. The area I live in, in Gurgaon is surrounded by a village that is inhabited by various classes of people. A large majority of this population falls below the poverty line. Therefore, being a member of this community who can come forward and help those around her, I introduce to you my feed the hungry campaign: Feed, Pray, Love.

The idea is to provide the people with four chapatis everyday along with pickles. We aim to feed 60,000 people in the first year with your contributions. The reason we have specifically chosen chapatis is because it is high on vitamins and minerals; it is good for digestion and due to its high carbohydrate level, it increases the energy levels of the consumer. Therefore, chapattis can be handed out, easily as well as be a meal on its own.  Further, in return for the meals we will ask the beneficiaries to do one good deed per day for the betterment of the community. This can involve anything from helping someone cross the road to offering a hug to someone who is going through a tough situation. Together we can make the world better. 


What We Need & What You Get

Although the process of making a chapati at home for a small group of people is an easy task, when the same number is multiplied by a few hundreds, the same job can seem to be herculean. However, this hurdle can be passed easily with the help of a chapatti making machine:

This will not only prove to be cost - effective in the long run but also be less time consuming. Therefore, saving on (cost + time) = more people will be fed!

The total amount we have decided to fundraise is an amalgamation of the cost of the machine, the machine's maintenance charges, the flour kneader, the flour cost/year, the salary of the hired workers,the electricity cost to power the machine, the transportation cost and the expenses taken on in making pickles.

The people who will be benefitted in the end are those who have probably not had the chance to sleep with a full stomach for the majority of their lives. Therefore, on any contributions that are made towards this campaign, it is only fitting that the donations make a difference to their lives as well as yours. Please find the perks listed on the right side of your screen!

Our determination to ensure that Feed, Pray, Love feeds those who go hungry every day is so resolute that no matter the funding we receive, we will put in all our hard work to ensure that it conquers hunger in Gurgaon. 

The Impact

The thought of filling 5,000 stomachs per month with your contributions leaves us giddy with joy. In a world where there is so much chaos and destruction, the thought of being able to fulfil a person's basic need for food amidst all of this, leaves one feeling calm and hopeful.
Anthony Marra, an author once wrote, 'We wear clothes, and speak, and create civilisations, and believe we are more than wolves. But inside us there is a word we cannot pronounce and that is who we are.' We firmly believe that feeding the hungry and contributing towards the betterment of humanity can bring us all closer to pronouncing that word. Let's do this together!

Risks & Challenges

The road to achieving our goals will not be smooth, but we are determined to overcome the obstacles for the people who are in dire need of food and proper meals throughout the day.
  • Funds - One of the main hurdles will be of collecting the required funds to not only kickstart this campaign but also sustain it. The basic requirements of the campaign, such as the chapati making machine, kneader, flour, transportation costs and so on can only be overcome when we have sufficient funds. Our way of overcoming this hurdle is by starting this online campaign on Indiegogo and placing our trust in the online community to provide a suitable conclusion to this good cause. Further we will also be participating in door to door campaigning, wherein we will encourage other residents of Gurgaon; our family, friends and relatives to contribute towards this cause. 
  • Distribution - Once the campaign has started, the process of distributing the chapatis and pickles will prove to be tricky. This is because we need to identify the precise time at which we can feed the most people in the vicinity. A way to overcome this is through thorough study, which is already underway during which we are speaking to the labourers, children and families in the slum areas to identify when and at which places we can serve the most people. 
  • Infrastructure - Gurgaon is infamous for its power cuts. However, with a chapati making machine and a tight meal distribution schedule we can't afford to be delayed by electricity lapses. Therefore, we intend to have a power back up system that can solve this problem. In the future, in order to make this project as environment friendly as possible, we are looking to install solar panels to power the chapati machine. 
  • Logistics - To make a chapati and deliver it into the hands of those who need it most, a chapati making machine and flour are not the only requirements. Things such as storage spaces, suitable packaging for chapatis and transportation costs also need to be kept in mind. We plan to overcome this by using a room in our own apartment as a storage space. As the volumes of chapatis increase, we will obviously need to shift to a larger space which will require funds. For the transportation, in the beginning we plan to deliver them via rickshaws. Using rickshaws, will also ensure that we will be employing the labourers (example: rickshaw drivers) in the delivery process so that they can deliver food to other hungry people like them in the area. Therefore, we will not only help with their meals but also their income. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions come in various forms, and while one aspect to it is monetary, you can help in other ways as well! For starters, give us a shout out on your facebook/twitter/blog accounts so that we can gather awareness and help. Please share this link as much as possible and if you have any further ideas for our campaign, please do write to us at: singh_nandita2003@yahoo.com
story_txt:
Short Summary In today's world what could you get in 20 cents? Probably something random off eBay or Amazon. It may also be useful as a paperweight. But what if you could feed an underprivileged person in just 20 cents?
The inception of Feed, Pray, Love began on the haphazard and dreary streets of my colony when I began to notice that there were far too many around me who were going to bed with an empty stomach. There were kids roaming around in tattered and unkempt clothes, labourers exhausted after a hard day of work and women who had toiled all day long at both in and out of the household and each one of them had one thing in common: their desire for a satisfying meal. That's all. 
At first I began sending fruits to the nearby school for the underprivileged everyday. However, the knowledge that I was still not doing enough would gnaw at me. The area I live in, in Gurgaon is surrounded by a village that is inhabited by various classes of people. A large majority of this population falls below the poverty line. Therefore, being a member of this community who can come forward and help those around her, I introduce to you my feed the hungry campaign: Feed, Pray, Love.
The idea is to provide the people with four chapatis everyday along with pickles. We aim to feed 60,000 people in the first year with your contributions. The reason we have specifically chosen chapatis is because it is high on vitamins and minerals; it is good for digestion and due to its high carbohydrate level, it increases the energy levels of the consumer. Therefore, chapattis can be handed out, easily as well as be a meal on its own.  Further, in return for the meals we will ask the beneficiaries to do one good deed per day for the betterment of the community. This can involve anything from helping someone cross the road to offering a hug to someone who is going through a tough situation. Together we can make the world better.     What We Need & What You Get Although the process of making a chapati at home for a small group of people is an easy task, when the same number is multiplied by a few hundreds, the same job can seem to be herculean. However, this hurdle can be passed easily with the help of a chapatti making machine:

This will not only prove to be cost - effective in the long run but also be less time consuming. Therefore, saving on (cost + time) = more people will be fed!
The total amount we have decided to fundraise is an amalgamation of the cost of the machine, the machine's maintenance charges, the flour kneader, the flour cost/year, the salary of the hired workers,the electricity cost to power the machine, the transportation cost and the expenses taken on in making pickles.
The people who will be benefitted in the end are those who have probably not had the chance to sleep with a full stomach for the majority of their lives. Therefore, on any contributions that are made towards this campaign, it is only fitting that the donations make a difference to their lives as well as yours. Please find the perks listed on the right side of your screen!
Our determination to ensure that Feed, Pray, Love feeds those who go hungry every day is so resolute that no matter the funding we receive, we will put in all our hard work to ensure that it conquers hunger in Gurgaon.    The Impact
The thought of filling 5,000 stomachs per month with your contributions leaves us giddy with joy. In a world where there is so much chaos and destruction, the thought of being able to fulfil a person's basic need for food amidst all of this, leaves one feeling calm and hopeful.
Anthony Marra, an author once wrote, 'We wear clothes, and speak, and create civilisations, and believe we are more than wolves. But inside us there is a word we cannot pronounce and that is who we are.' We firmly believe that feeding the hungry and contributing towards the betterment of humanity can bring us all closer to pronouncing that word. Let's do this together!
    Risks & Challenges
The road to achieving our goals will not be smooth, but we are determined to overcome the obstacles for the people who are in dire need of food and proper meals throughout the day.

Funds - One of the main hurdles will be of collecting the required funds to not only kickstart this campaign but also sustain it. The basic requirements of the campaign, such as the chapati making machine, kneader, flour, transportation costs and so on can only be overcome when we have sufficient funds. Our way of overcoming this hurdle is by starting this online campaign on Indiegogo and placing our trust in the online community to provide a suitable conclusion to this good cause. Further we will also be participating in door to door campaigning, wherein we will encourage other residents of Gurgaon; our family, friends and relatives to contribute towards this cause. 
Distribution - Once the campaign has started, the process of distributing the chapatis and pickles will prove to be tricky. This is because we need to identify the precise time at which we can feed the most people in the vicinity. A way to overcome this is through thorough study, which is already underway during which we are speaking to the labourers, children and families in the slum areas to identify when and at which places we can serve the most people. 
Infrastructure - Gurgaon is infamous for its power cuts. However, with a chapati making machine and a tight meal distribution schedule we can't afford to be delayed by electricity lapses. Therefore, we intend to have a power back up system that can solve this problem. In the future, in order to make this project as environment friendly as possible, we are looking to install solar panels to power the chapati machine. 
Logistics - To make a chapati and deliver it into the hands of those who need it most, a chapati making machine and flour are not the only requirements. Things such as storage spaces, suitable packaging for chapatis and transportation costs also need to be kept in mind. We plan to overcome this by using a room in our own apartment as a storage space. As the volumes of chapatis increase, we will obviously need to shift to a larger space which will require funds. For the transportation, in the beginning we plan to deliver them via rickshaws. Using rickshaws, will also ensure that we will be employing the labourers (example: rickshaw drivers) in the delivery process so that they can deliver food to other hungry people like them in the area. Therefore, we will not only help with their meals but also their income. 
   Other Ways You Can Help
Contributions come in various forms, and while one aspect to it is monetary, you can help in other ways as well! For starters, give us a shout out on your facebook/twitter/blog accounts so that we can gather awareness and help. Please share this link as much as possible and if you have any further ideas for our campaign, please do write to us at: singh_nandita2003@yahoo.com

story:
“We are not reconciled to the oppressors
who whet their howl on our grief.
We are not reconciled.”
- Gloria Anzaldua
It is important to recognize that gender identity transforms throughout a person’s lifetime. People who are aware of that rhythm of being may choose to categorize themselves as many identities including non-binary, transgender, Two Spirit, or genderqueer. Persons may not identify within the Man-Woman schema or binary, but some do. Others who, through assimilation or compulsivities, have remained within the binary may categorize themselves asgay or lesbian. It is also important to remember that a person’s gender is separate from their sex and from sexual orientation. Non-binary gender presentation and non-binary gender identity does not simply mean the opposite in this case. It means alternative as in another option, category, orchoice rather than opposite. We can look at it as a varied option in the systems of identity of those being limited to the duality of the modern colonial gender system. Ambiguous gender and ethnic identities, by virtue of not being able to be classified or categorized, are dichotomized into “suitable” Western binary categories. Not all people are born into their ‘appropriate’ group, especially for gender ambiguous individuals and people of color.
Or perhaps there is even more of a mismatch when you have the case of a gender nonconforming person of color. Though this identity formation starts at birth--the unlearning of these habits can last an entire lifetime. For multicultural persons and transgender individuals, navigating self defining roles and expectations could quite possibly be a self-damaging and counterproductive mode to a healthy identity formation. Comparing one’s self to a dominant class can cause an individual to suffer from the societal rejection mirrored in everyday life. Five years ago I started learning how to love that man that I am today. And I am a Man with top-notch mental health hygiene. For over twenty-five years, I lived as a very peculiar human, often reconciling the fact that I was a light-skinned lesbian that suffered from mental health issues. In Louisiana I had very little knowledge of gender, feminism or colonization. We were taught what they wanted us to be taught. Persons whose modes of being are fragmented can become severely effected by a variety of culture shocks.
I have come to fear the other-side.
The other-side is madness.
I keep my hidden self tucked so far away that I see it as my other-half.
I must walk in my worlds being told to choose masculinity or femininity.
My purpose for this essay is to fund my top surgery portion of my transgender viaticum.
